title: Featured News - Geocoded
name: Featured News - Geocoded
description: Yahoo pipe with featured world news.

properties.title: APEC meetings open with talk of Pacific Rim FTA
properties.description: Officials from 21 Pacific Rim economies, including the U.S, China and Japan, have kicked off meetings that could move toward a bold goal -- creating a Pacific-wide free trade zone.

properties.title: Asia shares gain amid higher commodity prices, G20
properties.description: Asian markets mostly climbed Thursday as higher oil and metals prices boosted commodity stocks and President Barack Obama called on world leaders at the Group of 20 summit to work together to advance the economic recovery.

properties.title: Bulgaria and Russia to sign energy deal
properties.description: The Bulgarian government announced Saturday it will sign a deal with Russia that will advance a pipeline project aimed at bringing Russian natural gas to central Europe and Italy.

properties.title: China, India, Brazil become 'major players' at IMF
properties.description: China and India received long-sought recognition Friday as global economic heavyweights as the International Monetary Fund gave them and other emerging powers a significantly larger role in stabilizing the world economy.

properties.title: China gets major stake in IMF vote overhaul
properties.description: In a historic decision, the International Monetary Fund board agreed Friday to boost the voting power of big emerging economies and make China the third leading voice in the global lender.

properties.title: China hikes bank reserves in move to cool lending
properties.description: Chinese banks were ordered to set aside more reserves Wednesday in a new move to curb lending as Beijing tries to cool rising inflation.

properties.title: China inflation jumps to 25-month high in October
properties.description: A double-digit jump in food costs drove China's inflation rate to a 25-month high of 4.4 percent in October despite a government clampdown on credit and efforts to cool living costs.

properties.title: China inflation rate to exceed 4 pct in 2011: report
properties.description: China's inflation rate will climb above 4 percent next year, with inflationary pressures peaking in the first few months of 2011, the official Xinhua News Agency reported on Saturday, citing a researcher with the country's State Information Center.

properties.title: China's president visits Portugal, eyes investment
properties.description: Chinese President Hu Jintao has started a two-day state visit to Portugal where officials are hoping investments by Beijing will help revive one of the European Union's frailest economies.

properties.title: Czech unions to strike to protest austerity moves
properties.description: Labor unions say state employees in the Czech Republic will go on a one-day strike next month to protest a government plan to reduce their salaries.

properties.title: EU needs euro1 trillion investment in energy
properties.description: The European Union said Wednesday it needs to invest euro1 trillion in pipelines, insulation and wind and solar technology over the next decade to meet its energy needs.

properties.title: European stocks ease back after bumper week
properties.description: European stock markets fell modestly Monday as investors took a breather following last week's big gains, which sent many of the world's major indexes above where they were when Lehman Brothers collapsed in September 2008.

properties.title: German Finance Minister attacks Fed move again : report
properties.description: German Finance Minister Wolfgang Schaeuble renewed his criticism of the U.S. Federal Reserve's move to buy $600 billion worth of government bonds, saying it undermined U.S. credibility and created uncertainty, according to a German magazine.

properties.title: German exports jump in September, fueling recovery
properties.description: German exports surged 22.5 percent in September, according to official data released Monday, which showed Europe's largest economy is recovering quickly but still depends largely on foreign demand for its industrial products.

properties.title: IMF says Ireland can manage amid EU rescue talks
properties.description: Ireland can manage on its own, the head of the International Monetary Fund said on Saturday, a day after euro zone sources told Reuters the former "Celtic Tiger" was in talks about a possible EU rescue.

properties.title: India Inc. gives Obama a warm welcome
properties.description: President Barack Obama's pledge to ease export controls that have long vexed India came as an unexpected salve in a relationship irritated by frictions over outsourcing and market access, Indian business leaders said Saturday.

properties.title: Ireland's crisis flares as investors dump bonds
properties.description: Ireland's financial troubles loomed large Wednesday as investors -- betting that the country soon could join Greece in seeking a bailout from the European Union -- drove the interest rate on the country's 10-year borrowing to a new high.

properties.title: Irish banks sink as EU eyes nation's survival plan
properties.description: Shares in Ireland's three publicly listed banks have all fallen to record lows as the government prepares to discuss its fiscal survival plans with the European Union commissioner for financial affairs, Olli Rehn.

properties.title: Jump in Chinese inflation points to more tightening
properties.description: Chinese inflation sped to a 25-month high in October and bank lending blew past expectations, highlighting the mounting challenge faced by Beijing to keep a grip on price pressures.

properties.title: Mexico ambassador says NRA can help stem gun flows
properties.description: The powerful National Rifle Association should be helping the United States and Mexico stem a flow of U.S. guns to Mexico's drug war, Mexico's top diplomat in Washington said on Wednesday.

properties.title: Montenegro freezes business citizenship offer
properties.description: Acting on an EU request, Montenegro has frozen its bid to grant citizenship to wealthy businessmen who invest in the country.

properties.title: New China bank rules weigh on world markets
properties.description: World markets mostly fell Wednesday after China's central bank announced it will raise the amount of cash that banks have to hold in reserve and the country's leading credit rating agency lowered its view on the U.S. in the wake of the Federal Reserve's decision to pump another $600 billion into the U.S. economy.

properties.title: No let-up for Irish debt; pressure grows
properties.description: Clearing house LCH.Clearnet hiked margin requirements for Irish debt on Wednesday and Ireland's central bank said it would take a closer look at banks' residential mortgage books as concern mounted about the country's finances.

properties.title: Obama salutes US troops, condemns North Korea
properties.description: Celebrating America's Veterans Day, President Barack Obama on Thursday saluted the bravery of U.S. troops who defended South Korea during its war with North Korea and condemned the communist north for continuing on a course that he says deepens its isolation from the rest of the world along with the poverty of its people.

properties.title: Obama says US, Asia will benefit from more trade
properties.description: Appealing for broader access to fast-growing markets in Asia, President Barack Obama says the United States is in the Pacific region to stay and that both sides will benefit from stronger trade relationships.

properties.title: Oil price rise not threat to global recovery: IMF
properties.description: The International Monetary Fund does not see a rise in oil prices as a threat to the global economic recovery and will closely monitor a new round of U.S. policy easing, a senior IMF official said on Saturday.

properties.title: Orascom Telecom sees surge in NKorea subscribers
properties.description: Mobile phone service subscriptions in Orascom Telecom's North Korean joint venture climbed over 400 percent in the 12-month period ending September 2009, the Egyptian telecom giant said, as it pushes ahead with coverage plans in the reclusive communist nation.

properties.title: PC maker Lenovo's quarterly profit up 45 percent
properties.description: Lenovo Group, the world's fourth-largest personal computer maker, said Wednesday its latest quarterly profit rose 45 percent on strong sales in China and other emerging markets.

properties.title: Recovery needs G-20 unity, Bank of England says
properties.description: World leaders at the Group of 20 summit this week need to cooperate more closely on global economic imbalances or they will put the recovery at serious risk, Bank of England Governor Mervyn King said Wednesday.

properties.title: Russian reporter in coma after beating in Moscow
properties.description: Two unknown men waited for Russian journalist Oleg Kashin to come home and then bludgeoned him on his head, arms and legs. Yet his editor said it was Kashin's mangled hands -- with part of one pinky broken off -- that showed his attackers wanted to make sure he never wrote again.

properties.title: Singapore Air to change oil-stained A380 engines
properties.description: Singapore Airlines will replace engines on three of its Airbus A380 planes after finding oil stains on them, almost a week after Australian rival Qantas grounded its A380 fleet due to an engine failure.

properties.title: `Staff of life' wavers under weight of humanity
properties.description: In these volcanic valleys of central Mexico, on the Canadian prairie, across India's northern plain, they sow and they reap the golden grain that has fed us since the distant dawn of farming.

properties.title: TPC Group starts Dutch auction tender offer
properties.description: TPC Group Inc. is starting a modified Dutch auction tender offer to buy back up to $130 million of its shares. During a Dutch auction, the bidder chooses how many shares they want to buy and at what price.

properties.title: Thousand march against French pension reform plan
properties.description: The two months of French protests against the government's bill to raise the retirement age from 60 to 62 fizzled on Saturday, with President Nicolas Sarkozy all but certain to sign it into law this month.

properties.title: Tomas a tropical storm after soaking Haiti
properties.description: Tropical Storm Tomas spun away from the Turks and Caicos Islands and into the open Atlantic on Saturday, gradually losing steam a day after battering seaside towns in Haiti as a hurricane.

properties.title: Tomas heads to open Atlantic after soaking Haiti
properties.description: Tropical Storm Tomas spun away from the Turks and Caicos Islands and into the open Atlantic on Saturday, gradually losing steam a day after battering seaside towns in Haiti as a hurricane.

properties.title: Trichet: ECB support temporary not QE, backs recovery
properties.description: The European Central Bank&#39;s crisis support measures are temporary in nature and should not be confused with quantitative easing, European Central Bank President Jean-Claude Trichet said on Saturday.

properties.title: UAE's Emirates, Etihad airlines halt Yemen cargo
properties.description: Airlines in the United Arab Emirates say they have stopped carrying cargo from Yemen as a precaution following the discovery of two mail bombs shipped as air freight.

properties.title: UK's Cameron urges Chinese political reform
properties.description: British Prime Minister David Cameron urged China on Wednesday to embrace political reform as the best way to ensure social stability and continued economic growth.

properties.title: UK's Cameron visits China seeking trade, influence
properties.description: British Prime Minister David Cameron was leading his country's largest ever delegation to China on Monday, hoping to win trade and woo a powerful potential ally as London seeks to cultivate ties beyond Washington and Europe.

properties.title: U.S., Japan sees need to address China rare earth reliance
properties.description: Japan and the United States agreed on the need to address the problem of relying too much on a single country for production and supply of rare earths, a Japanese government official said on Wednesday.

properties.title: World Bank chief surprises with gold standard idea
properties.description: Leading economies should consider adopting a modified global gold standard to guide currency rates, World Bank president Robert Zoellick said on Monday in a surprise proposal before a potentially acrimonious G20 summit.

properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20101104/wl_afp/greeceattacks"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101104/capt.photo_1288872746723-4-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=vDsDJulxpn82bjtX5imzsw--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="Police investigators search for evidence after controlled explodion of a package outside the ACS courier offices in Athens. A Greek judge charged two men with terrorism as police announced that a 14th parcel bomb had been dealt with after delivery at the French embassy in Athens.(AFP/Louisa Gouliamaki)" border="0"/></a>AFP - A Greek judge charged two men with terrorism Thursday as police announced that a 14th parcel bomb had been dealt with after delivery at the French embassy in Athens.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20101105/wl_afp/cubaaccidentair"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101105/capt.photo_1288977895261-10-0.jpg?x=130&y=82&q=85&sig=JG6eHi._iUDhO4dWCFSGaA--" align="left" height="82" width="130" alt="An Army helicopter overflies the site where a domestic Aerocaribbean aircraft crashed on November 4, in the mountainous Sancti Spiritus region, near Guasimal, some 400 km east of Havana. properties.title: Suicide attack at Pakistan mosque kills 61 (AFP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20101105/wl_sthasia_afp/pakistanunrest"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101105/capt.photo_1288959628354-13-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=NKl1KdsrL2PBPd2GzsvYLw--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="Pakistani volunteers carry an injured man to the hospital in Peshawar after a suicide bomb tore through a Pakistani mosque. The blast during the main weekly prayers killed 61 people and left human remains trapped under a collapsed roof and pulverised rubble.(AFP/Hasham Ahmed)" border="0"/></a>AFP - A suicide bomber destroyed a Pakistani mosque on Friday, killing 61 people during the main weekly prayers and leaving body parts under a collapsed roof and pulverised rubble.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: NATO probes reports of Afghan attack on troops (AFP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20101106/wl_afp/afghanistanunrestshooting"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101106/capt.photo_1289036346527-1-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=hNdQ4dF9kZqtQq0yA0QBCg--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="US Army soldiers patrol Siah Choy village in Zari district of Kandahar province, south of Afghanistan on October 24. NATO has said it is investigating reports that an Afghan soldier had shot and killed foreign troops, while a NATO official said on condition of anonymity that two US Marines had died.(AFP/Massoud Hossaini)" border="0"/></a>AFP - NATO said Saturday it was investigating reports that an Afghan soldier had shot and killed foreign troops, while a NATO official said on condition of anonymity that two US Marines had died.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Obama urges India, Pakistan to improve relations (AFP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20101107/pl_afp/indiausdiplomacy"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101107/capt.photo_1289125542106-2-0.jpg?x=130&y=104&q=85&sig=NgUGzMzPD2PucQScHfAzqQ--" align="left" height="104" width="130" alt="US President Barack Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama make a statement after visiting the 26/11 Memorial at the Taj Mahal Palace and Tower Hotel in Mumbai. Obama urged India and Pakistan to talk to resolve their differences, as the focus of his trip switched to stability in the volatile region after a day of trade deals.(AFP/JIM WATSON)" border="0"/></a>AFP - US President Barack Obama urged India and Pakistan to talk to resolve their differences Sunday, as the focus of his trip switched to stability in the volatile region after a day of trade deals.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Myanmar votes in rare election marred by fraud fears (AFP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20101107/wl_asia_afp/myanmarvote"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101107/capt.photo_1289115615179-2-0.jpg?x=130&y=88&q=85&sig=7AflPSNac8TR1MQokAhygA--" align="left" height="88" width="130" alt="A Myanmar voter has her documents checked by officials before casting her vote. Myanmar voted in its first election in 20 years as complaints of intimidation added to fears the poll was a sham to create a facade of democracy after decades of iron-fisted military rule.(AFP/Hla Hla Htay)" border="0"/></a>AFP - Myanmar voted Sunday in its first election in 20 years as complaints of intimidation added to fears the poll was a sham to create a facade of democracy after decades of iron-fisted military rule.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Violence breaks out in Myanmar after election (AFP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20101108/wl_asia_afp/myanmarvote"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101108/capt.photo_1289218033149-1-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=6dwYVrwWhZ6HkHCEc5O8BA--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="Refugees from Myanmar sit in a temporary shelter set up by the Thai government inside a Buddhist monestary in Mae Sot, western Thailand. Deadly clashes have erupted between Myanmar government troops and ethnic minority rebels, prompting an exodus across the border as the junta's proxies prepared to claim victory in a widely criticised election.(AFP/Kc Ortiz)" border="0"/></a>AFP - Deadly clashes erupted on Monday between Myanmar government troops and ethnic minority rebels, prompting an exodus across the border in the wake of an election that the junta's proxies looked sure to win.</p><br clear="all"/>

Awlaqi has called for the killing of Americans "// border="0"/></a>AFP - US-Yemeni radical cleric Anwar al-Awlaqi has called for the killing of Americans "without hesitation," in a video message posted on jihadist websites, US monitoring group SITE said on Monday.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: G20 leaders head into trade showdown (AFP)

properties.title: Bombs kill six Baghdad Christians, sow panic (AFP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20101110/wl_afp/iraqunrestchristians"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101110/capt.photo_1289395071695-1-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=msHjzKWPS1YPl5oY7hDykw--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="A child walks past destroyed vehicles in a mainly Christian neighborhood of central Baghdad on November 10. properties.title: Obama says Indonesia's unity is inspiration to world (AFP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20101110/pl_afp/usindonesiadiplomacyobama"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101110/capt.photo_1289369041493-5-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=ZqRphQERZJIm23EhQityKA--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="US special security personnel checks the weapon of the Indonesian presidential guard of honor before the departure of US President Barack Obama at the Halim Perdanakusuma military airport in Jakarta on November 10, 2010.(AFP/Roslan Rahman)" border="0"/></a>AFP - US President Barack Obama Wednesday celebrated Indonesia's evolution from the rule of the "iron fist" to democracy and lauded his boyhood home's spirit of tolerance as a model for Islam and the West.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: G20 leaders head into trade showdown (AFP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20101111/bs_afp/economyfinanceg20summit"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101111/capt.photo_1289425768193-1-0.jpg?x=130&y=89&q=85&sig=lewmXL4Q7nP7WaiBg6UEWw--" align="left" height="89" width="130" alt="Anti-G20 protesters wearing the masks of US President Barack Obama (L) and South Korean President Lee Myung-Bak (R) take part in a candlelight vigil at a rally denouncing the G20 Summit in Seoul.(AFP/Park Ji-Hwan)" border="0"/></a>AFP - The world's 20 biggest rich and emerging economies intensified a war of words hours before the start Thursday of a summit devoted to recalibrating huge distortions in the global economy.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Qantas jumbo makes emergency landing in Singapore (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101104/ap_on_bi_ge/as_singapore_qantas_emergency"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101104/capt.bf6faeea090e435c9a01b5819ac122e7-cc13e0f7f38a48eabf2e3815d9809120-0.jpg?x=130&y=78&q=85&sig=LHKF4.gjf0dhOW181.7Bkg--" align="left" height="78" width="130" alt="Firefighters surround a Qantas passenger plane which made an emergency landing with 459 people aboard in Singapore's Changi International Airport after having engine problems Thursday, Nov. 4, 2010. properties.title: NIreland lawmakers deemed too fat for Afghan trip (AP)
properties.description: AP - Britain's defense ministry says two lawmakers from Northern Ireland have been barred from visiting troops in Afghanistan until they can find flak jackets big enough to fit their bellies.

properties.title: Spain finds new way to push for gender equality (AP)
properties.description: AP - Spain's reform-minded Socialist government wants to erase male bias in the country's double-barrel last names.

properties.title: Westwood fires 66, Tiger shoots 68 in Shanghai (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101104/ap_on_sp_go_su/glf_hsbc_champions"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101104/capt.a5dafb1e5b1b4248a72b35a878a9840f-a5dafb1e5b1b4248a72b35a878a9840f-0.jpg?x=130&y=88&q=85&sig=KuDnkn.5.LAFMsYGRh.m6A--" align="left" height="88" width="130" alt="Tiger Woods of the United States lines up a putt on the 18th green during the first round of the HSBC Champions golf tournament at the Shanghai Sheshan International Golf Club Thursday, Nov. 4, 2010 in Shanghai, China. (AP Photo)" border="0"/></a>AP - Lee Westwood didn't feel as though he had to prove why he was No. 1 in the world. With one quality shot after another Thursday in the HSBC Champions, he sure served up a reminder.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Official: 1 Yemen bomb 17 mins. from exploding (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101104/ap_on_re_eu/mail_bombs"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101102/capt.photo_1288708031298-1-0.jpg?x=130&y=115&q=85&sig=XP5H6smFCnnRGdUZdm2OrA--" align="left" height="115" width="130" alt="A map showing the locations where two parcel bombs were intercepted in transit to the USA. The United States intercepted parcels from Yemen in September thought to be a dry run for the package bomb plot, a US official said, as Western governments tightened freight and passenger security.(AFP/Graphic)" border="0"/></a>AP - One of two mail bombs sent from Yemen last week was disarmed just 17 minutes before it was set to go off, the French interior minister said Thursday, but the White House said it had no information that would confirm that.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Tropical Storm Tomas approaches Haiti, Jamaica (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101104/ap_on_bi_ge/tropical_weather"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101104/i/r4169986655.jpg?x=86&y=130&q=85&sig=vrZg50z0QKqz3TIBx7NExw--" align="left" height="130" width="86" alt="A Haitian earthquake survivor is seen at Canan II camp about 19 miles (30 km) north of Port-au-Prince November 3, 2010. Tropical Storm Tomas barreling toward Haiti threatens hundreds of thousands with deadly floodwaters and will likely worsen a cholera epidemic that has already killed more than 440 people, the United Nations said on Wednesday. The cyclone is expected to hit Haiti on Friday. REUTERS/Eduardo Munoz (HAITI - Tags: DISASTER ENVIRONMENT)" border="0"/></a>AP - Haiti urged hundreds of thousands of homeless quake survivors to flee tents and tarps for sturdier shelter Thursday as Tropical Storm Tomas closed in with rains that threaten to unleash devastating floods. Many stayed put &mdash; either to protect their few possessions for lack of anywhere to go.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Applications for jobless aid rise sharply (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101104/ap_on_bi_go_ec_fi/us_economy"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101104/capt.d8c52cad7b44422f96df9cbc3820a772-d8c52cad7b44422f96df9cbc3820a772-0.jpg?x=130&y=85&q=85&sig=NEVkdklemc5PtIDROVRTbw--" align="left" height="85" width="130" alt="FILE - In this March 5, 2009 file photo, job seekers join a line of hundreds of people at a job fair sponsored by Monster.com, in New York. The Labor Department said Thursday, Nov. 4, 2010, the number of people seeking jobless benefits jumped sharply last week, after two straight weeks of declines.(AP Photo/Mark Lennihan, file)" border="0"/></a>AP - The number of people seeking jobless benefits jumped sharply last week, after two straight weeks of declines.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Obama challenges Cabinet, sets bipartisan talks (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101104/ap_on_go_pr_wh/us_obama"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101103/capt.photo_1288807430695-13-0.jpg?x=130&y=90&q=85&sig=mfEg6DcY5uzR3r5MHcAPPg--" align="left" height="90" width="130" alt="US President Barack Obama pauses before answering a question during a press conference on midterm elections in the East Room at the White House in Washington, DC. Obama admitted Wednesday he suffered a "/ border="0"/></a>AP - President Barack Obama sought Thursday to retake the political initiative after a bruising election, inviting Republican and Democratic congressional leaders for talks and challenging his Cabinet to make Washington work better.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Rap star Lil Wayne released from NYC jail (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101104/ap_on_en_mu/us_people_lil_wayne"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101101/capt.110eb6fa580447d1a554b72ecf5d6aa4-110eb6fa580447d1a554b72ecf5d6aa4-0.jpg?x=97&y=130&q=85&sig=JcYbxEsEg5E0ay0_2CLxDQ--" align="left" height="130" width="97" alt="** FILE ** In this Jan. 30, 2009 file photo, Rapper Lil Wayne arrives on the red carpet for a party in Tampa, Fla. Lil Wayne is in jail, but his public persona is still active. (AP Photo/Steve Nesius, file)" border="0"/></a>AP - Lil Wayne has been freed from jail after serving eight months in a gun case, emerging with a hot new album, well-wishes from a former president and a deepened appreciation for his fans.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: No clear path for GOP on health care repeal (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101104/ap_on_bi_ge/us_repeal_and_replace"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101103/capt.f3a86fa1ddb64ec8b87b294f0492ed22-f3a86fa1ddb64ec8b87b294f0492ed22-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=fo7dpXhuBEPDpMOHeSnc2g--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="President Barack Obama listens to a question during a news conference in the East Room of the White House in Washington, Wednesday, Nov. 3, 2010. (AP Photo/Charles Dharapak)" border="0"/></a>AP - Republicans say they'll repeal and replace President Barack Obama's health care law, but tinker and tweak is as far as they're likely to get.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Indonesia volcano burns whole villages; 122 dead (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101105/ap_on_re_as/as_indonesia_disasters"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101105/capt.788e831a1adf4f579c5c4b349452d5e3-73aa4bf3157540acb0c421fa4a9d3040-0.jpg?x=130&y=84&q=85&sig=1AX.UaiJ.r6Yz5CejrRyBA--" align="left" height="84" width="130" alt="Indonesian soldier and rescuers run after an eruption of Mount Merapi in Argomulyo, Yogyakarta, Indonesia, Friday, Nov. 5, 2010. (AP Photo/Trisnadi)" border="0"/></a>AP - A surge of searing gas raced down the sides of Mount Merapi on Friday, smothering houses, cattle and villagers in its path. The death toll after the volcano's largest eruption in a century soared to 122.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Earthquakes dog Clinton on overseas trips (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101105/ap_on_re_as/as_us_clinton_quakes"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101105/capt.5bb855fb043345718cc43872ff7ed80b-5bb855fb043345718cc43872ff7ed80b-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=dr2m5WqdQMJTjdJABOqJ3Q--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton gestures during an event on Antarctic cooperation at the U.S. Antarctic Program Center on Friday, Nov. 5, 2010 in Christchurch, New Zealand. (AP Photo/Evan Vucci, Pool)" border="0"/></a>AP - What is it about Hillary Rodham Clinton and earthquakes? Seems the secretary of state rarely takes an overseas trip that is not in some way affected by a temblor. Clinton and her staff were jolted from sleep in their hotel rooms in New Zealand early Saturday by a strong aftershock from a 7-magnitude quake that struck in September. It was the second aftershock since she arrived here Friday.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Judge orders Lori Berenson freed from prison (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101105/ap_on_re_la_am_ca/lt_peru_lori_berenson"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101105/capt.6ea6829ea78543649d502ce8e494b7ef-6ea6829ea78543649d502ce8e494b7ef-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=wkuNGn3hAHPDcbVM8TL2yw--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="U.S. Lori Berenson, left, listens to a judicial clerk at a courthouse in Lima, Peru, Friday, Nov. 5, 2010. A Peruvian judge has ordered that convicted rebel collaborator Lori Berenson be released from prison on parole. (AP Photo/Karel Navarro)" border="0"/></a>AP - A Peruvian judge ordered convicted rebel collaborator Lori Berenson freed from prison Friday, ruling her initial parole decision sound, but the New Yorker's legal troubles remained unresolved.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Al-Qaida group takes responsibility for mail bombs (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101105/ap_on_re_mi_ea/mail_bombs"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101105/capt.6d1c91f2c4dd4c4d95994cc7b03672aa-6d1c91f2c4dd4c4d95994cc7b03672aa-0.jpg?x=130&y=94&q=85&sig=.ShUXmlc72qxBsGTfiImZg--" align="left" height="94" width="130" alt="Armed Yemeni police stand guard by closed UPS office Thursday, Nov. 4, 2010, in San'a, Yemen. One of two mail bombs sent from Yemen last week was disarmed just 17 minutes before it was set to go off, the French interior minister said Thursday. (AP Photo/Hasan Jamali)" border="0"/></a>AP - A Yemen-based al-Qaida group on Friday claimed responsibility for the international mail bomb plot uncovered late last week as well as the crash of a United Parcel Service cargo plane in September.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Hurricane adds to Haiti's woes, 4 dead in floods (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101105/ap_on_bi_ge/tropical_weather"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101105/capt.abcbd69d4ac646149290103f07b00c46-7db3e60d6f2c4cf79091fb8742bdd6a6-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=qBLA54YBiG2kysNQrdqNKQ--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="People wade through a flooded street during the passing of Hurricane Tomas in Leogane, Haiti, Friday Nov. 5, 2010. (AP Photo/Ramon Espinosa)" border="0"/></a>AP - Hurricane Tomas flooded camps of earthquake refugees, turning some into squalid islands Friday as it battered Haiti's rural western tip, while largely sparing the vast homeless encampments in the shattered capital.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Officials: Suspect lived unnoticed after 'death' (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101105/ap_on_re_us/us_declared_dead"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101104/capt.a4350cb9924e436b95a787523a41fe43-a4350cb9924e436b95a787523a41fe43-0.jpg?x=103&y=130&q=85&sig=2vB85sWPOp_K8ziawQlStQ--" align="left" height="130" width="103" alt="Thomas Steven Sanders is seen in an undated photo provided by FBI New Orleans. The FBI has issued a federal kidnapping warrant for Thomas Steven Sanders in connection with a Lexis Kaye Roberts, a 12-year-old Nevada girl whose body was found in early October in Louisiana. Law officials said Thursday, Nov. 4, 2010 that Lexis Kaye Roberts was last seen with her mother and Sanders. The girl's skeletal remains were found in a wooded area of Catahoula Parish. (AP Photo/FBI New Orleans)" border="0"/></a>AP - After the skeletal remains of a slain Las Vegas girl were found in the Louisiana woods, investigators reached a startling conclusion: The man suspected of kidnapping her was supposed to have died 16 years earlier.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Sharron Angle not likely to flee politics (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101105/ap_on_el_se/us_nevada_senate_angle"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101103/capt.c9d18c2e20e148128594d6bc84618926-c9d18c2e20e148128594d6bc84618926-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=SduIno67OodlqffzwgP0Pg--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="Republican Senate candidate Sharron Angle concedes in her race against Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid at her election night party Wednesday, Nov. 3, 2010, in Las Vegas. (AP Photo/Julie Jacobson)" border="0"/></a>AP - Sharron Angle's tea party revolution came up short in her bid to oust Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid, but her political career appears far from over.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Pelosi will seek to stay as House Dem leader (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101105/ap_on_go_co/us_pelosi_house_leadership"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101103/capt.f9d1d6c7dee246a6a8ea668479d117d1-f9d1d6c7dee246a6a8ea668479d117d1-0.jpg?x=130&y=73&q=85&sig=kvGffEVkUh7UyOOYXxo2mQ--" align="left" height="73" width="130" alt="House Speaker Nancy Pelosi of Calif., waits to speak to supporters at an election night party in Washington, Tuesday, Nov. 2, 2010. (AP Photo/Alex Brandon)" border="0"/></a>AP - Despite widespread complaints about massive losses that will put Democrats in the minority, Speaker Nancy Pelosi said Friday she will try to stay on as leader of her party in the House.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: White ex-transit officer given 2-year prison term (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101105/ap_on_re_us/us_train_station_shooting"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101105/capt.81f08597029a4a6cbdc4acd9ff04ed38-81f08597029a4a6cbdc4acd9ff04ed38-0.jpg?x=130&y=81&q=85&sig=GLGIHOJp.bknZ5.zcZcBNg--" align="left" height="81" width="130" alt="Hundreds of demonstrators attend a rally after the sentencing of former Bay Area Rapid Transit police officer Johannes Mehserle in Oakland, Calif., Friday, Nov. 5, 2010. Mehserle was convicted of involuntary manslaughter for the fatal shooting of Oscar Grant at a BART station on Jan. 1, 2009. Los Angeles Superior Court Judge Robert Perry sentenced Mehserle&#xc2; to two years in prison. (AP Photo/Paul Sakuma)" border="0"/></a>AP - A white former transit officer was sentenced to the minimum possible prison sentence of two years Friday for fatally shooting an unarmed black man on a California train platform, angering the victim's family and friends, who demanded a much harsher punishment.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: MSNBC suspends Olbermann for political donations (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101105/ap_on_en_tv/us_tv_nbc_olbermann"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101105/capt.3745e6cc1f1647c0b8483fd5b7e66710-3745e6cc1f1647c0b8483fd5b7e66710-0.jpg?x=130&y=97&q=85&sig=8M_wugCQT_djo6kqYMBmLw--" align="left" height="97" width="130" alt="FILE - In this May 3, 2007 file photo, Keith Olbermann of MSNBC poses at the Ronald Reagan Library in Simi Valley, Calif., (AP Photo/Mark J. Terrill, file)" border="0"/></a>AP - MSNBC has suspended prime-time host Keith Olbermann indefinitely without pay for contributing to the campaigns of three Democratic candidates this election season.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Fear of volcanic ash cancels flights to Jakarta (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_re_as/as_indonesia_disasters"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.94f073c55b764fdf8204374ca5993814-8babefe044db4a6aa81312899d8f99e1-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=F19oUGTyK2MJoHHVA3vC6Q--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="Villagers ride a motorcycle as a miniature of 9th century Borobudur Temple is seen covered with volcanic ash from the eruption of Mount Merapi, in Muntilan, Central Java, Indonesia, Indonesia, Saturday, Nov. 6, 2010. (AP Photo)" border="0"/></a>AP - International airlines fearful of volcanic ash canceled flights Saturday into Indonesia's capital, while the closure of airports nearest Mount Merapi has delayed the arrival of burn cream and ventilators for those whose skin and lungs were singed by searing gases. The series of eruptions, including the deadliest in decades, has killed 138 people.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Giant Jesus statue completed in Polish town (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_re_eu/eu_poland_giant_jesus"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.0122bc9954aa458390ad39c923bc07c1-e6de313acee6407f8ca788c6f37e5e04-0.jpg?x=91&y=130&q=85&sig=MCAPJBapvDv9q97wxod_WQ--" align="left" height="130" width="91" alt="A cyclist passes a new monument to Jesus in Swiebodzin, Poland, on Saturday Nov. 6, 2010. A local priest built what his town members claim is now the largest statue of Jesus Christ in the world. (AP Photo/Czarek Sokolowski)" border="0"/></a>AP - A gigantic statue of Jesus that Poles claim is the world's largest rose majestically above a small town on Saturday, as the grandiose dream of a local priest finally came to pass.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Pope heads to liberal Spain to press church agenda (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_re_eu/eu_pope"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101105/capt.7aa9a20c315949199b224b18b9353550-7aa9a20c315949199b224b18b9353550-0.jpg?x=130&y=85&q=85&sig=xgKc9noXeHW5HNItDRuquA--" align="left" height="85" width="130" alt="Police guard Obradoiro square that overlooks the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela, background, in northern Spain, on Friday, Nov. 5, 2010. Pope Benedict XVI will visit the pilgrimage city of Santiago de Compostela on Nov. 6 to celebrate his Holy year. (AP Photo/Paulo Duarte)" border="0"/></a>AP - Pope Benedict XVI begins a pilgrimage to Spain on Saturday to visit two of Christianity's most spectacular sites, fulfilling a long-held personal wish while pressing his bid to revive the faith in a once-staunchly Catholic country that is now among Europe's most liberal.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Molinari stays in front of Westwood at HSBC (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_sp_go_su/glf_hsbc_champions"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.ba5c2e9073eb4a2288dc828145c4cffc-ba5c2e9073eb4a2288dc828145c4cffc-0.jpg?x=130&y=100&q=85&sig=HgRQOwtLXmjX29l_1FcHnw--" align="left" height="100" width="130" alt="Francesco Molinari of Italy lines up his putt on the third hole during the third round of Shanghai HSBC Champions golf tournament at the Sheshan International Golf Club in Shanghai, China Saturday, Nov. 6, 2010. (AP Photo/Andy Wong)" border="0"/></a>AP - Francesco Molinari holed out for eagle from the 13th fairway, matched the lowest score of the third round and still had to make a 10-foot birdie putt on the last hole to keep the lead over Lee Westwood in the HSBC Champions on Saturday.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Reputed drug kingpin killed in Mexico shootout (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_re_la_am_ca/lt_drug_war_mexico"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.71f8a43a63844c46b976f4923cc530ab-71f8a43a63844c46b976f4923cc530ab-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=SA3vLOYg8UQAKi1A9A0xRA--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="Navy marines walk behind an armored pick-up truck during a gunfight with alleged cartel members in the northern border city of Matamoros, Mexico, Friday Nov. 5, 2010. During the operation, Mexican marines killed reputed Gulf cartel leader and one of Mexico's most-wanted drug lords, Antonio Ezequiel Cardenas Guillen, alias 'Tony Tormenta,' or 'Tony the Storm,' according to the Mexican navy. (AP Photo/El Bravo de Matamoros)" border="0"/></a>AP - Mexican marines killed a reputed Gulf cartel leader and one of Mexico's most-wanted drug lords in a spectacular, hours-long gunbattle near the U.S. border, the latest in a growing number of hits on the country's drug kingpins.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Saudis warned US of aviation bomb plot weeks ago (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_bi_ge/mail_bombs"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101105/capt.6d1c91f2c4dd4c4d95994cc7b03672aa-6d1c91f2c4dd4c4d95994cc7b03672aa-0.jpg?x=130&y=94&q=85&sig=.ShUXmlc72qxBsGTfiImZg--" align="left" height="94" width="130" alt="Armed Yemeni police stand guard by closed UPS office Thursday, Nov. 4, 2010, in San'a, Yemen. One of two mail bombs sent from Yemen last week was disarmed just 17 minutes before it was set to go off, the French interior minister said Thursday. (AP Photo/Hasan Jamali)" border="0"/></a>AP - Western officials are crediting a Saudi intelligence tip they received in early October, nearly three weeks before terrorists in Yemen managed to smuggle mail bombs onto airplanes, with heading off what could have been a series of catastrophic explosions aboard jetliners.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Around the world, a race against time bombs in air (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_re_us/mail_bombs_race_against_time"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.6d1c91f2c4dd4c4d95994cc7b03672aa-eee14e2286854910990792c59ad2ed5f-0.jpg?x=130&y=94&q=85&sig=xEPoMOPoEy5YXcCz59NflA--" align="left" height="94" width="130" alt="FILE - In this Nov. 4, 2010 file photo, armed Yemeni police stand guard by a closed UPS office in San'a, Yemen. (AP Photo/Hasan Jamali, File)" border="0"/></a>AP - The woman stepped off Hadda Street into a pair of courier offices in Yemen's capital. In FedEx and UPS storefronts tucked along shopping centers and travel agencies in San'a, she mailed two Hewlett-Packard printers to the United States.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Yemen orders US-born cleric found 'dead or alive' (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_re_mi_ea/ml_yemen_al_qaida"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.c5e721e8f29a4ff9b346bae2e04ab6c8-43d1461301f547c09b2b8e3fc874fecb-0.jpg?x=97&y=130&q=85&sig=HI3lHLe8e0YS2rZTZg7wqA--" align="left" height="130" width="97" alt="FILE - This Oct. 2008 file photo shows Imam Anwar al-Awlaki, a U.S.-born Yemeni cleric and recruiter for al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula, in Yemen. Authorities in Yemen have ordered the arrest of the radical US-born cleric who has inspired attacks against the West. (AP Photo/Muhammad ud-Deen, File) MANDATORY CREDIT, NO SALES." border="0"/></a>AP - A Yemeni judge ordered police Saturday to find a radical U.S.-born cleric "dead or alive" after the al-Qaida-linked preacher failed to appear at his trial for his role in the killing of foreigners.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Obama calls India creator, not poacher, of US jobs (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_re_us/obama_asia"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.0bf1f189c6ae446bafb34a0a7960b9e5-6b82171b3f064e50b838ed889880b127-0.jpg?x=130&y=95&q=85&sig=4Yp1tbFu2iFZw.17t0RL3Q--" align="left" height="95" width="130" alt="U.S. President Barack Obama and first lady Michelle Obama make a statement after their visit the memorial for the Nov. 26, 2008 terror attack victims at the Taj Mahal Palace and Tower Hotel in Mumbai, India, Saturday, Nov. 6, 2010. (AP Photo/Charles Dharapak)" border="0"/></a>AP - Searching for help half a world away, President Barack Obama on Saturday embraced India as the next jobs-creating giant for hurting Americans, not a cheap-labor rival that outsources opportunity from the United States.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Jockeys Borel, Castellano fight at Breeders' Cup (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_sp_ot/rac_breeders__cup_fight"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101105/capt.048cb22c375647bfb24f8916070b1d18-90fc348734684f33bbc074d5b8c808e1-0.jpg?x=92&y=130&q=85&sig=rFtA5BH6QQZEFpFrfnLKrw--" align="left" height="130" width="92" alt="Jockey Calvin Borel is restrained after the Marathon race at the Breeder's Cup horse races at Churchill Downs Friday, Nov. 5, 2010, in Louisville, Ky. Borel and Javier Castellano exchanged punches moments after the race, following a mid-race incident in which Castellano's horse Prince Will I Am ran into the path of Romp and Martin Garcia. Garcia was able to stay on top of his horse but also impeded Borel and A.U. Miner. (AP Photo/Garry Jones)" border="0"/></a>AP - Jockey fights in horse racing are as much a part of the sport as whips, saddles and the $2 bet.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Tomas a tropical storm after soaking Haiti (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_bi_ge/tropical_weather"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.cf0a9886c57b4d94a53a857e1a303900-b1a45b73e80d48f8a1ea90baa057eb4c-0.jpg?x=130&y=92&q=85&sig=g1MIvh9sjjUiFBdd35T_uA--" align="left" height="92" width="130" alt="A man carries a child while wading across a flooded street during the passing of Hurricane Tomas in Leogane, Haiti, Friday Nov. 5, 2010. (AP Photo/Ramon Espinosa)" border="0"/></a>AP - Tropical Storm Tomas spun away from the Turks and Caicos Islands and into the open Atlantic on Saturday, gradually losing steam a day after battering seaside towns in Haiti as a hurricane.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Bernanke defends new Fed plan to boost economy (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_re_us/us_bernanke_stimulus"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101103/i/r399876178.jpg?x=130&y=88&q=85&sig=PXfH0U8SRHdi3S_qB41dTg--" align="left" height="88" width="130" alt="U.S. Federal Reserve Board Chairman Ben Bernanke testifies before the Senate Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs Committee on the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act on Capitol Hill in Washington in this September 30, 2010 file photo. The Federal Reserve is expected to announce a controversial new policy later on November 3, 2010, to buy billions of dollars in government bonds in an attempt to breathe new life into a struggling U.S. economy. REUTERS/Richard Clement/files (UNITED STATES - Tags: POLITICS BUSINESS)" border="0"/></a>AP - Federal Reserve Chairman Ben Bernanke defended the Fed's new $600 billion program to aid the economy on Saturday, rejecting concerns that it will spur runaway inflation.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Bush to speak with Lauer, Winfrey, Leno, others (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_en_tv/us_books_bush_tour"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.d9916784d2f94fe8957ecd068641c42c-3eeae96099ef4565863b4820ffdf224f-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=adO776qwrTOXpHg3Qfem.A--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="This photo taken Oct. 28, 2010 and provided by Harpo Productions Inc., shows talk-show host Oprah Winfrey interviewing former President George W. Bush during taping of 'The Oprah Winfrey Show' at Harpo Studios in Chicago. The show will air nationally on Tuesday, Nov. 9, 2010. (AP Photo/Harpo Productions Inc., George Burns) NO SALES" border="0"/></a>AP - The world will soon be hearing a lot from former President George W. Bush.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Economy recovering, but recession's shadow is long (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_bi_ge/us_consumer_chill"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.2ed8c2b8ed2d4c2aacbbafce8a5fe3c9-2ed8c2b8ed2d4c2aacbbafce8a5fe3c9-0.jpg?x=130&y=92&q=85&sig=XNt569t.GLnAx0S8OtylYg--" align="left" height="92" width="130" alt="In this Oct. 14, 2010 photo, shoppers go into a Goodwill store in Paramus, N.J. During the Great Recession, people made drastic changes in how they spent their money. They stopped treating credit cards as cash. They learned to save and learned to wait. (AP Photo/Mel Evans)" border="0"/></a>AP - Layaway, once the province of the poor, has gone mainstream. At the Mall of America in Minnesota, shoppers dart in for just one or two things. In New York, socialites do the unthinkable: They wear the same ball gown twice.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Jury deliberates for 2nd day in home invasion case (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_re_us/us_home_invasion"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101103/capt.7c62e4b030e541fbbefe6c1a55b6869f-7c62e4b030e541fbbefe6c1a55b6869f-0.jpg?x=107&y=130&q=85&sig=lMxz0fSsBT3pLHiZD5JjiA--" align="left" height="130" width="107" alt="FILE - This undated inmate file photo released in February 2010 by the Connecticut Department of Correction shows Steven Hayes, accused of severely beating Dr. William Petit, Jr., and killing his wife and two daughters during a home invasion in Cheshire, Conn., July 23, 2007. Hayes' attorneys are challenging a judge's decision to replace a regular juror with an alternate to determine his sentence. A hearing will be held Wednesday, Nov. 3, 2010, in New Haven, Conn., on the motion. The jury is expected to begin deliberations Friday on whether Hayes should get the death sentence or life in prison. (AP Photo/Connecticut Department of Correction, File)" border="0"/></a>AP - A Connecticut jury has begun a second day of deliberations to determine if a man convicted in a deadly home invasion should get the death penalty or life in prison.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Oscar-nominated actress Jill Clayburgh dead at 66 (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_en_mo/us_obit_clayburgh"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.f2e4337ef0fd4539a7fddc2df1d98a93-f2e4337ef0fd4539a7fddc2df1d98a93-0.jpg?x=88&y=130&q=85&sig=T8ELZnH6zNkQatoHT_mWkA--" align="left" height="130" width="88" alt="FILE - In this May 15, 2007 file photo, Jill Clayburgh, star of 'Dirty Sexy Money' poses for photographers on the red carpet during the arrivals of ABC's 2007-2008 preview in New York. Jill Clayburgh, whose Broadway and Hollywood acting career stretched through the decades, highlighted by her Oscar-nominated portrayal of a divorcee exploring her sexuality in the 1978 film 'An Unmarried Woman,' died Friday, Nov. 5, 2010. She was 66. (AP Photo/Seth Wenig, File)" border="0"/></a>AP - Jill Clayburgh, the sophisticated Hollywood and Broadway actress known for portrayals of empowered women in a career spanning five decades, highlighted by her Oscar-nominated role of a divorcee exploring life after marriage in the 1978 film "An Unmarried Woman," has died. She was 66.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Lil Wayne shows up at NBA game after NY release (AP)
properties.description: AP - Lil Wayne turned up courtside in red baseball cap and long dreadlocks to watch the unbeaten New Orleans Hornets edge the Miami Heat 96-93 Friday night, a day after his release from a New York City jail.

properties.title: Complaints that tea party hurt GOP's Senate hopes (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_el_se/us_tea_party_senate"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101104/capt.ec478e39cafc433c815271f40325708c-ec478e39cafc433c815271f40325708c-0.jpg?x=130&y=83&q=85&sig=MObd49D65fttwvS09jYy4g--" align="left" height="83" width="130" alt="Delaware Republican senate candidate Christine O'Donnell, left, and Democratic Senator-elect Chris Coons, right, pose with a hatchet that is symbolically buried at the end of each election season in Delaware at Return Day, Thursday, Nov. 4, 2010, in Georgetown, Del. (AP Photo/Rob Carr)" border="0"/></a>AP - Tea party-backed candidates helped and hindered Republicans, injecting enthusiasm into campaigns but losing Senate seats held by Democrats in Delaware, Colorado and Nevada that the GOP once had big hopes of capturing.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: White ex-officer's sentence spurs Oakland protest (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_re_us/us_train_station_shooting"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.73824f34bb6342748f91dd0c09561146-73824f34bb6342748f91dd0c09561146-0.jpg?x=130&y=87&q=85&sig=xMgNA8rvMmhdXLTJc0RHjA--" align="left" height="87" width="130" alt="A demonstrator lies on ground in protest after the sentencing in Oakland, Calif., Friday, Nov. 5, 2010 of former Bay Area Rapid Transit police officer Johannes Mehserle. Mehserle was convicted of involuntary manslaughter for the fatal shooting of Oscar Grant at a BART station on Jan. 1, 2009. Los Angeles Superior Court Judge Robert Perry sentenced Mehserle&#xc2; to two years in prison. (AP Photo/Noah Berger)" border="0"/></a>AP - Police made more than 150 arrests as a crowd broke windows and knocked down fences, protesting a Los Angeles court decision to sentence a white former transit officer to the minimum term for fatally shooting an unarmed black man.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Blacks struggle with 72 percent unwed mothers rate (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101106/ap_on_re_us/us_unwed_births72_percent"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.442cfad120414fdc83ea4a63fb565dd5-1fc5dd9adee14d7f999363c44d945cf2-0.jpg?x=130&y=123&q=85&sig=II0i9Ao7lVVsp667_QxABA--" align="left" height="123" width="130" alt="In this Oct. 30, 2010 photo, Christelyn Karazin holds her 15-month-old daughter, Emma, while her husband, Mike, sits with son Zachary, 5, daughter, Chloe, 7, and Kayla Higgins, 12, Christelyn's daughter, at their home in Temecula, Calif. Karazin had her first child with her boyfriend while she was in college; they never married. Her last three came after she married another man and became a writer and homemaker in an affluent Southern California suburb. In September, Karazin marshaled 100 other writers and activists for the online movement No Wedding No Womb, which she calls &#xe2;&#x80;&#x9c;a very simplified reduction of a very complicated issue.' (AP Photo/Lenny Ignelzi)" border="0"/></a>AP - One recent day at Dr. Natalie Carroll's OB-GYN practice, located inside a low-income apartment complex tucked between a gas station and a freeway, 12 pregnant black women come for consultations. Some bring their children or their mothers. Only one brings a husband.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Kenyan police officer kills 10 people in rampage (AP)
properties.description: AP - A police officer in a central Kenyan town went on a shooting rampage, killing 10 people in three different bars, officials and a local journalist said Sunday.

properties.title: APEC meetings open with talk of Pacific Rim FTA (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_bi_ge/as_apec"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.dab26aeeb66044abafac96f03c03290f-dab26aeeb66044abafac96f03c03290f-0.jpg?x=130&y=82&q=85&sig=U5y2w4KvUwBJ6egkLfsPOA--" align="left" height="82" width="130" alt="Chinese Vice Minister of Finance Wang Jun, right, speaks during a joint press conference of APEC Finance Ministers Meeting at Kyoto International Conference Center in Kyoto, Japan, Saturday, Nov. 6, 2010. (AP Photo/Shizuo Kambayashi)" border="0"/></a>AP - Officials from 21 Pacific Rim economies, including the U.S., China and Japan, began meetings Sunday that could move toward a bold goal &mdash; creating a Pacific-wide free trade zone.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Gates urges Congress to repeal gay ban now (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_re_as/as_election_gates"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101107/capt.a8513b3ac8214bc5b6b85a57e5c92190-a8513b3ac8214bc5b6b85a57e5c92190-0.jpg?x=81&y=130&q=85&sig=CqKULV0hHJ.ZlTmAkHasRA--" align="left" height="130" width="81" alt="FILE - Defense Secretary Robert Gates speaks during a joint new conference with Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton, not seen, in this Oct. 14, 2010 file photo, at NATO headquarters in Brussels. Gates said Saturday Nov. 6, 2010, as he traveled to defense and diplomatic meetings in Australia, 'I would like to see the repeal of 'don't ask, don't tell' but I'm not sure what the prospects for that are.' (AP Photo/Carolyn Kaster, File)" border="0"/></a>AP - U.S. Defense Secretary Robert Gates said Congress should act quickly, before new members take their seats, to repeal the military's ban on gays serving openly in the military.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Fear of volcanic ash cancels flights to Jakarta (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_re_as/as_indonesia_disasters"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.3c9310698908420a8c57980a510424b5-3c9310698908420a8c57980a510424b5-0.jpg?x=130&y=92&q=85&sig=FpwsbGe1cBpwDRVDMqKJBg--" align="left" height="92" width="130" alt="Villagers ride on their motorcycle as Mount Merapi spewing volcanic materials in the background in Srumbung, Central Java, Indonesia, Indonesia, Saturday, Nov. 6, 2010. (AP Photo)" border="0"/></a>AP - Just days before President Barack Obama's long-awaited visit to Indonesia, international carriers canceled flights to the capital over concerns about a volcano spewing ash hundreds of miles away.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Indonesian volcano sparks travel chaos (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_re_as/as_indonesia_volcano"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101107/capt.08cc81878f79425ab4d82d59ab4b5162-08cc81878f79425ab4d82d59ab4b5162-0.jpg?x=130&y=83&q=85&sig=yc41CRaOqRMwSulvqTk5_Q--" align="left" height="83" width="130" alt="Volcanic ash from the eruption of Mount Merapi covers a village in Muntilan, Central Java, Indonesia, Sunday, Nov. 7, 2010. Just days before President Barack Obama's long-awaited visit to Indonesia, international carriers canceled flights to the capital over concerns about the volcano spewing ash hundreds of miles away. (AP Photo/Trisnadi)" border="0"/></a>AP - Indonesia's most volatile volcano sparked transportation chaos Sunday, with several international airlines canceling flights to the capital and neighboring Malaysia airlifting out hundreds of its citizens.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Myanmar holds rare elections amid heavy criticism (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_re_as/as_myanmar_election"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101107/capt.48e906eadfda48848d096998a18d7820-48e906eadfda48848d096998a18d7820-0.jpg?x=130&y=85&q=85&sig=nY8AYfMJWVqZey7sxCb2LA--" align="left" height="85" width="130" alt="Voters line up outside a local polling station to vote for the elections on Sunday, Nov. 7, 2010, in Bago, about 90 km (about 50 miles) northeast of Yangon, Myanmar. Voters in Myanmar's first election in 20 years cast their ballots Sunday amid both a barrage of criticism that the balloting was rigged in favor of the ruling military and hope that some change toward democratic reform might nonetheless follow. (AP Photo/Khin Maung Win)" border="0"/></a>AP - Voters in Myanmar's first elections in 20 years cast their ballots Sunday amid a barrage of criticism that the balloting was rigged in favor of the ruling military, as well as hope that some change toward democratic reform might nonetheless follow.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Missing turbine part key to A380 emergency probe (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_re_as/as_qantas_emergency"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.4b30ec969e314505be532645e912d415-4b30ec969e314505be532645e912d415-0.jpg?x=130&y=94&q=85&sig=gQpemniopEuR.nUenjMBnw--" align="left" height="94" width="130" alt="Qantas CEO Alan Joyce, standing in front of an Airbus A380, comments in Sydney, Saturday, Nov. 6, 2010 on an incident involving a Qantas flight from Singapore. On Thursday, one of a Qantas A380's four Rolls-Royce Trent 900 engines failed on a Qantas flight from Singapore to Sydney, shedding pieces of metal over Indonesia before it returned to make a safe emergency landing in Singapore. (AP Photo/Rick Rycroft)" border="0"/></a>AP - Investigators of last week's engine explosion on a Qantas superjumbo focused their search Sunday on a missing piece of turbine from the Rolls-Royce engine, and the airline said it hoped to have its grounded fleet of A380s back in service within days.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: US, Australia expand ties with an eye on China (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_re_as/as_us_australia"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.d377f84260774d3cb872f2aa3fff6f61-d377f84260774d3cb872f2aa3fff6f61-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=u1rW1Ctu49VD7Qy977Y0XA--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton, left, and Australian Foreign Minister Kevin Rudd take part in a joint news conference on Saturday, Nov. 6, 2010 in Melbourne, Australia. (AP Photo/Evan Vucci, Pool)" border="0"/></a>AP - The United States plans to expand its military presence in Australia as the two nations maneuver to rein in an increasingly assertive China.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Local Greek poll a test for rescue deal (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_re_eu/eu_greece_elections"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.cbf3b4e819b34e7a9884b32a26f7e975-cbf3b4e819b34e7a9884b32a26f7e975-0.jpg?x=92&y=130&q=85&sig=lPU5QFeWHSCpUJoJJEq_Qw--" align="left" height="130" width="92" alt="Pedestrians pass under the photo of Vassilis Kikilias, candidate Greater Athens area governor supported by opposition conservative party New Democracy, on Saturday, Nov. 6, 2010. Voters in crisis-hit Greece cast ballots in local polls Sunday, in a major test of public support for austerity measures that could trigger a snap general election. The vote pits Prime Minister George Papandreou's 13-month-old Socialist government against opposition parties all campaigning against the terms rescue-loan deal with the European Union and IMF. The sign on the candidate's photograph reads '' Vassilis Kikilias, Candidate Regional Governor.'' (AP Photo/Thanassis Stavrakis)" border="0"/></a>AP - Greeks were casting ballots Sunday in local polls that could trigger a general election unless voters show support for the governing Socialists' austerity measures in the debt-strapped country.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Pope defends family as Spanish gays hold 'kiss-in' (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_re_eu/eu_pope"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101107/capt.9a50cae05c124d958e69f6e8203dfd03-9a50cae05c124d958e69f6e8203dfd03-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=pg2poRtsWFC2LEyxsqkViQ--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="Pope Benedict XVI waves from his pope-mobile on his way to the Sagrada familia church in Barcelona , Spain, Sunday, Nov. 7, 2010. Pope is in the city of Barcelona to consecrate La Sagrada Familia church the Barcelona landmark, whose construction began in 1882 and is still continuing. The church is designed by architect Antoni Gaudi, who died in 1926. (AP Photo/Daniel Ochoa de Olza)" border="0"/></a>AP - Pope Benedict XVI has strongly defended traditional families and the rights of the unborn on his visit to Spain, directly attacking laws allowing gay marriage, fast-track divorce and easier abortions.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Swedish police arrest suspected serial shooter (AP)
properties.description: AP - Swedish police have arrested a 38-year-old man suspected of a series of shootings of people with immigrant backgrounds in southern Sweden, officials said Sunday.

properties.title: TCU rolls, Alabama gets pushed out of title race (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_sp_co_ga_su/fbc_t25_top25_rdp"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.31e00cc5b37a4a2894ff32b79f38426e-31e00cc5b37a4a2894ff32b79f38426e-0.jpg?x=130&y=88&q=85&sig=1mzUhTfthPErLkElhbsDwQ--" align="left" height="88" width="130" alt="TCU wide receiver Jimmy Young (88) catches a touchdown pass while being defended by Utah linebacker Chaz Walker (32) during the second half of their NCAA college football game Saturday, Nov. 6, 2010, in Salt Lake City. TCU won 47-7. (AP Photo/Jim Urquhart)" border="0"/></a>AP - Joe Paterno reached another magic number and Michigan played maybe the wildest game in its storied history.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Molinari holds steady to win HSBC Champions (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_sp_go_su/glf_hsbc_champions"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101107/capt.17fac2ec21ea42ad91bb7fe6d095bc07-17fac2ec21ea42ad91bb7fe6d095bc07-0.jpg?x=96&y=130&q=85&sig=k9Mh2VvMaWb9_C2TFofSXw--" align="left" height="130" width="96" alt="Francesco Molinari of Italy blasts the ball from the fairway of the fourth hole during the Shanghai HSBC Champions golf tournament at the Sheshan International Golf Club in Shanghai, China Sunday, Nov. 7, 2010. (AP Photo/Andy Wong)" border="0"/></a>AP - Francesco Molinari outlasted Lee Westwood in a spirited duel Sunday in the HSBC Champions for a one-shot victory to capture his first World Golf Championship and continue a memorable year for Italy.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Drug lord's death could empower rival Zetas gang (AP)

properties.title: Obama arrives in New Delhi (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_re_us/obama_asia"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101107/capt.c4a36494638645619e30f816c5d24398-c4a36494638645619e30f816c5d24398-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=AYC06lKGO7bvkYQOCv1tCQ--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="President Barack Obama takes questions from students at a town-hall style event with students at St. Xavier's College in Mumbai, India, Sunday, Nov. 7, 2010. (AP Photo/Charles Dharapak)" border="0"/></a>AP - President Barack Obama has arrived in New Delhi, India, his second stop on a three-day visit to the world's largest democracy.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Obama visits students, enjoys Diwali festival (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_re_us/obama_asia_children"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.e9e1ccc0c160482dacd650170be033b5-e9e1ccc0c160482dacd650170be033b5-0.jpg?x=130&y=88&q=85&sig=Fim4PI4ovHPJ1Lz36oLGPg--" align="left" height="88" width="130" alt="U.S. first lady Michelle Obama, left, plays a 'Duff' an Indian percussion instrument, with underprivileged children at the Mumbai University in Mumbai, India, Saturday, Nov. 6, 2010. U.S. President Barack Obama began a 10-day trip through Asia on Saturday. (AP Photo/Rajanish Kakade)" border="0"/></a>AP - President Barack Obama is showing a softer side of his agenda in India, chatting with high school students and reveling in the celebration of a major religious festival.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Haiti 'got very lucky' as Tomas skirted island (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_bi_ge/tropical_weather"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.2edd2f80ff44434e87b7966dbf977a1b-318b9eef66f846b48cd44571e86cf907-0.jpg?x=130&y=92&q=85&sig=AcUVqx9_v0GDjhRgZS6OWw--" align="left" height="92" width="130" alt="People walk in a flooded street after the passing of Hurricane Tomas in the neighborhood of Cite Soleil in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, Saturday Nov. 6, 2010. (AP Photo/Ramon Espinosa)" border="0"/></a>AP - Hurricane Tomas pushed northward from Haiti on Saturday, leaving villagers to mop up, evacuees to return to their tents and most everyone relieved that the country did not suffer what could have been its first big disaster since the January earthquake.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Economy recovering, but recession's shadow is long (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_bi_ge/us_consumer_chill"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101106/capt.0163397259604fa889cb1c0b73f054e2-0163397259604fa889cb1c0b73f054e2-0.jpg?x=130&y=75&q=85&sig=ktm5cOuD8CgH5i743lAaLQ--" align="left" height="75" width="130" alt="In this Oct. 27, 2010 photo, the Mall of America is shown in Bloomington, Minn. During the Great Recession, people made drastic changes in how they spent their money. They stopped treating credit cards as cash. They learned to save and learned to wait. (AP Photo/Jim Mone)" border="0"/></a>AP - Layaway, once the province of the poor, has gone mainstream. At the Mall of America in Minnesota, shoppers dart in for just one or two things. In New York, socialites do the unthinkable: They wear the same ball gown twice.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Marines' leader: Keep policy on gays in military (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101107/ap_on_re_us/us_gays_in_military_marines"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101107/capt.fc1aed975a1b41df89d661af6a62b8a9-fc1aed975a1b41df89d661af6a62b8a9-0.jpg?x=107&y=130&q=85&sig=Zn3gXZeBGwgeMo4Lgv_a1Q--" align="left" height="130" width="107" alt="FILE - In this Tuesday, June 22, 2010 file photo, Gen. James Amos, Assistant Commandant of the U.S. Marine Corp, testifies on Capitol Hill in Washington, before the Senate Armed Services Committee hearing on military suicides. Gen. James Amos, the new commandant of the U.S. Marines Corps said Saturday, Nov. 6, 2010 that now is the wrong time to overturn the 'don't ask, don't tell' policy prohibiting gays from openly serving in the military, as U.S. troops remain in the thick of war in Afghanistan.(AP Photo/Susan Walsh, File)" border="0"/></a>AP - With American troops in the thick of the fighting in Afghanistan, the new commandant of the Marines Corps says now is not the time to overturn the "don't ask, don't tell" policy prohibiting gays from openly serving in the military.</p><br clear="all"/>

(AP Photo/Noah Berger)" border="0"/></a>AP - Looking out her front window in a usually quiet residential neighborhood in this city, Deanna Goldstein's knees began to shake.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Many flee Indonesia volcano amid fears of eruption (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101108/ap_on_re_as/as_indonesia_volcano"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101108/capt.photo_1289217069633-1-0.jpg?x=99&y=130&q=85&sig=W2zGF5sQ073xz3CnAyfs.w--" align="left" height="130" width="99" alt="Mount Merapi spews ash to the sky on November 8, 2010. International flights to Indonesia's capital Jakarta returned to normal on Monday, officials said, a day ahead of a visit by US President Barack Obama, after volcanic ash caused a weekend of travel chaos.(AFP/File/Bay Ismoyo)" border="0"/></a>AP - Frightened residents abandoned their homes in a bustling city of 400,000 at the foot of Indonesia's rumbling volcano Monday, cramming onto trains, buses and rented vehicles as authorities warned Mount Merapi could erupt again at any time.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Qantas CEO: Oil leaks in 3 engines of its A380s (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101108/ap_on_bi_ge/as_qantas_emergency"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101107/capt.8463ab9f16f748d597e14dd9b75d8983-e3702bf0aecc4175a37006cd1a873215-0.jpg?x=130&y=73&q=85&sig=eyUKEDQN_3F_9LM38P9K6g--" align="left" height="73" width="130" alt="This undated image provided by the Australian Transport Safety Bureau shows a jagged and bent piece of a turbine disc from a Qantas superjumbo Rolls-Royce engine that exploded Thursday, Nov. 4, 2010. (AP Photo/ATSB) EDITORIAL USE ONLY" border="0"/></a>AP - Tests have uncovered oil leaks in three Rolls-Royce engines on Qantas' grounded Airbus A380s, the airline's CEO said Monday, as engineers tried to zero in on the cause of an engine failure on board one of the carrier's superjumbo jets last week.</p><br clear="all"/>

(AP Photo/Fabrizio Troccoli, file)" border="0"/></a>AP - Former University of Washington student Amanda Knox has been indicted on slander charges in Italy for claiming she was beaten by police when questioned in 2007 about her roommate's slaying.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Bush: Cheney angry Bush did not pardon Libby (AP)
properties.description: AP - Former President George W. Bush says Vice President Dick Cheney angrily confronted him over Bush's decision not to pardon a former vice presidential aide over his role in the case of the leaked identity of CIA operative Valerie Plame.
