properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101108/ap_on_hi_te/us_tec_broadband_data"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101107/capt.093e8319ad62471a80c51e8e45e69b6c-093e8319ad62471a80c51e8e45e69b6c-0.jpg?x=130&y=76&q=85&sig=8yy7VoT.N5OEnbf86sRbKQ--" align="left" height="76" width="130" alt="Graphic shows increase of broadband Internet use since" border="0"/></a>AP - The U.S. still faces a significant gap in residential broadband use that breaks down along incomes, education levels and other socio-economic factors, even as subscriptions among American households overall grew sevenfold between 2001 and 2009.</p><br clear="all"/>

Olbermann acknowledged to NBC that he donated $2,400 apiece to the campaigns of Kentucky Senate candidate Jack Conway and Arizona Reps. Raul Grivalva and Gabrielle Giffords. properties.title: Obama: Strong US economy key to global recovery (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101110/ap_on_bi_ge/obama_asia"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.a0a765fea63c408d9d9eda2f68cfe8fd-a0a765fea63c408d9d9eda2f68cfe8fd-0.jpg?x=130&y=89&q=85&sig=Bflq.2SKSPD4AL367bTsNg--" align="left" height="89" width="130" alt="President Barack Obama greets members of the crowd, some of which were old classmates from when he lived and studied in Indonesia, after he addressed the nation at the University of Indonesia in Jakarta, Indonesia, on Wednesday, Nov. 10, 2010. (AP Photo/Gregory Bull)" border="0"/></a>AP - The former fun seekers of the Carnival Splendor are cruising again &mdash; but just barely.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: GM reports $2B 3Q profit ahead of stock offering (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101110/ap_on_bi_ge/us_earns_gm"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.dba0e5716f8b40948056f99744aeac6a-0e7e1e2e0a784b92be4944ad628e4aec-0.jpg?x=95&y=130&q=85&sig=tO3WIGbgwAN9tE_IKDsl0A--" align="left" height="130" width="95" alt="FILE - In this Oct. 28, 2010 fie photo, General Motors Co. CEO Dan Akerson, announces plans to spend $190 million to build a new Cadillac small car at its Lansing Grand River plant in Lansing, MIch. General Motors said Wednesday, Nov. 10, it made $2 billion in the third quarter, a strong showing that helps the company's pitch to investors who may buy stock in an initial public offering. (AP Photo/Carlos Osorio, file)" border="0"/></a>AP - Strong profits on new cars and trucks helped General Motors Co. earn $2 billion in the third quarter, enhancing the company's appeal as it nears next week's initial public stock offering.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Jobless claims fall sharply to 4-month low (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101110/ap_on_bi_go_ec_fi/us_economy"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.8a03875bb4ef4275833a5a50a67d2ee1-8a03875bb4ef4275833a5a50a67d2ee1-0.jpg?x=117&y=130&q=85&sig=mo5YHvKeAZUvP1bmphzxlQ--" align="left" height="130" width="117" alt="Job seekers fill out job applications during a job fair at the The Radisson Martinique hotel, Tuesday, Nov. 9, 2010 in New York. Applications for unemployment benefits drop sharply Wednesday, Nov. 10, to lowest level since July. (AP Photo/Mary Altaffer)" border="0"/></a>AP - Fewer people applied for unemployment aid last week, the third drop in four weeks and evidence that the job market is showing signs of life.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Feds proposes graphic cigarette warning labels (AP)
properties.description: AP - The federal government hopes new larger, graphic warning labels for cigarettes that include images of corpses, cancer patients, and diseased lungs and teeth will help snuff out tobacco use.

properties.title: Taylor Swift named BMI songwriter of the year (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101110/ap_on_en_mu/us_music_bmi_awards"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.b2e2e67260974da9ab9117536e864aac-b2e2e67260974da9ab9117536e864aac-0.jpg?x=85&y=130&q=85&sig=6XIcdQv.m9WEoiETEJ8zzQ--" align="left" height="130" width="85" alt="Recording artist Taylor Swift arrives at the 2010 BMI Country Awards Tuesday, Nov. 9, 2010 in Nashville, Tenn. (AP Photo/Evan Agostini)" border="0"/></a>AP - Taylor Swift was named country songwriter of the year at the BMI Awards on Tuesday night, becoming the youngest person to win the award at age 20.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Jason Garrett era begins for 1-7 Dallas Cowboys (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_sp_fo_ne/fbn_cowboys_garrett_takes_over"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.1e809cd126894d56860403d8598d7b26-1e809cd126894d56860403d8598d7b26-0.jpg?x=96&y=130&q=85&sig=1fqGvSidCMs0b1dWesk1Nw--" align="left" height="130" width="96" alt="Dallas Cowboys interim head coach Jason Garrett smiles as he chats with players before the start of NFL football practice at the team's training facility, Wednesday, Nov. 10, 2010, in Irving, Texas. (AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez)" border="0"/></a>AP - Jason Garrett stood with his arms crossed watching the special teamers work on punting, then he wandered over to defensive players walking onto the field and greeted them with fist bumps and handshakes. Offense, defense and special teams &mdash; they all work for him now.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Moss says he hopes he fits into Titans' offense (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_sp_fo_ne/fbn_titans_moss"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.bbec8313a37c41608b3742d18573dc35-bbec8313a37c41608b3742d18573dc35-0.jpg?x=130&y=95&q=85&sig=3Mb5776Mo8fPUf60eNprGA--" align="left" height="95" width="130" alt="Tennessee Titans wide receiver Randy Moss catches a pass during practice on Wednesday, Nov. 10, 2010, in Nashville, Tenn. The Titans claimed Moss off waivers last week, becoming the third team Moss has played for this season. (AP Photo/Mark Humphrey)" border="0"/></a>AP - Randy Moss says he's sorry things didn't work out with in Minnesota and that he isn't upset with the Vikings or coach Brad Childress for waiving him. The well-traveled receiver insists he isn't in town &mdash; his third NFL city this season &mdash; to start trouble.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Letter: Mexican cartel offers to dissolve itself (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_re_la_am_ca/lt_drug_war_mexico"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.476fc9eac78e448d9b9ae293a8697aab-476fc9eac78e448d9b9ae293a8697aab-0.jpg?x=130&y=87&q=85&sig=8m7T_UOJV.CyB0yaa2IWsA--" align="left" height="87" width="130" alt="Packages of marijuana burn during an incineration program in Tijuana, Mexico, Wednesday Nov. 10, 2010. More than 20 tons of marijuana and other seized drugs were incinerated by the Prosecutor General office in Tijuana. (AP Photo/Guillermo Arias)" border="0"/></a>AP - A letter purportedly signed by a major Mexican drug cartel offers to dissolve the gang if the government promises to protect citizens in the western state where it is based, authorities said Wednesday.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Mexico uses robot to explore ancient tunnel (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_sc/lt_mexico_archaeology_robot"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.fa4339e2574746a281893f6eff9aaa4a-fa4339e2574746a281893f6eff9aaa4a-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=kuoruun4MjqMMltiBZH_Ow--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="Press photographers make photos of a robot used to explore the ruins in Teotihuacan, Mexico, Wednesday, Nov. 10, 2010. The small foot-wide wheeled vehicle, able to record video, entered a 2,000-year-old tunnel found earlier this year under the ruins of the temples of Teotihuacan. (AP Photo/Alexandre Meneghini)" border="0"/></a>AP - The first robotic exploration of a pre-Hispanic ruin in Mexico has revealed that a 2,000-year-old tunnel under a temple at the famed Teotihuacan ruins has a perfectly carved arch roof and appears stable enough to enter, archaeologists announced Wednesday.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Iraqi PM to stay on as political deadlock ends (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_re_mi_ea/ml_iraq_politics"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.4b54df4a540d4b6e89ab229bc9c0906c-4b54df4a540d4b6e89ab229bc9c0906c-0.jpg?x=92&y=130&q=85&sig=VprNAL80ksK1OX8VJ_eqBg--" align="left" height="130" width="92" alt="FILE - In this Jan 23, 2009 file photo, Iraqi Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki is seen at a rally in Basra, Iraq. Iraqi lawmakers are working furiously to end the country's eight-month political deadlock with reports that a deal may be near to return Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki to office. (AP Photo/Nabil al-Jurani, File)" border="0"/></a>AP - Prime Minister Nouri al-Maliki will return to power for another four-year term after Iraqi lawmakers working late into the night Wednesday agreed on a tentative deal to form a new government, lawmakers said.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Obama salutes US troops, condemns North Korea (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_bi_ge/obama_asia"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101111/capt.1cd5ad0345324a27af5b67d1e1514ec6-1cd5ad0345324a27af5b67d1e1514ec6-0.jpg?x=97&y=130&q=85&sig=GMJx3St6cir31LnzvOvCPg--" align="left" height="130" width="97" alt="President Barack Obama speaks at a Veteran's Day event at U.S. Army Garrison Yongsan in Seoul, South Korea, Thursday, Nov. 11, 2010. (AP Photo/Pablo Martinez Monsivais)" border="0"/></a>AP - Celebrating America's Veterans Day, President Barack Obama on Thursday saluted the bravery of U.S. troops who defended South Korea during its war with North Korea and condemned the communist north for continuing on a course that he says deepens its isolation from the rest of the world along with the poverty of its people.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Qantas keeps its A380s on the ground (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_re_us/superjumbo_woes"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.766b49c08f8646b59ad341f263afcc6d-766b49c08f8646b59ad341f263afcc6d-0.jpg?x=130&y=92&q=85&sig=delh2zVehJKqBQY6Jr6Cqw--" align="left" height="92" width="130" alt="FILE &mdash; A Singapore Airlines Airbus A-380 has its engine checked, at the Airport Zuerich, in Switzerland, in this Nov. 4, 2010 file photo. Tests uncovered oil stains in three Rolls-Royce engines on Singapore Airlines' A380 superjumbos, prompting the airline to yank the planes from service Wednesday Nov. 10, 2010 just two days after Qantas announced troubling oil leaks on their A380s. (AP Photo/Keystone, Steffen Schmidt, File)" border="0"/></a>AP - Qantas says it is extending the time its Airbus superjumbo fleet will be grounded because it hasn't finished safety checks.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Write-in ballot count begins in Alaska Senate race (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_el_se/us_alaska_senate"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101111/capt.d46f974cab7e4e5f96546e6f820ee20c-929897bb54cb4dddadcacb6f244c1874-0.jpg?x=130&y=97&q=85&sig=xEfHVN8hbiQjai5EQHxoSg--" align="left" height="97" width="130" alt="Alaska Elections Division Director Gail Fenumiai looks over a ballot Wednesday, Nov. 10, 2010, in Juneau, Alaska. Misspellings and poor penmanship took center stage Wednesday in Alaska's contentious U.S. Senate race as teams of election workers began tallying more than 92,500 write-in ballots, with the two candidates' lawyers and observers intently watching the tedious process unfold. (AP Photo/Rick Bowmer)" border="0"/></a>AP - Alaska election officials began counting more than 92,500 write-in ballots Wednesday in a Senate race that may hinge on voters' penmanship and their ability &mdash; or lack of &mdash; to spell "Murkowski" on their write-in ballots.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: AP-GfK Poll: Palin most polarizing of 2012 crowd (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_el_pr/us_ap_poll_republicans"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.6151cb86ca8a4a25b884d9add98e7763-6151cb86ca8a4a25b884d9add98e7763-0.jpg?x=110&y=130&q=85&sig=W1bESObGIg5SkrQckWKRrQ--" align="left" height="130" width="110" alt="FILE - In this Oct. 23, 2010 file photo, former Alaska Gov. Sarah Palin speaks to supporters at a Republican National Committee rally in Orlando, Fla. (AP Photo/John Raoux, File)" border="0"/></a>AP - Sarah Palin is the most polarizing of the potential 2012 Republican presidential candidates, while impressions of Mike Huckabee and Mitt Romney lean more positive, according to an Associated Press-GfK poll. As for the rest &mdash; Pawlenty, Barbour, Thune, Daniels &mdash; most Americans say, "Who?"</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Passengers cheer as hobbled ship heads to Calif. (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_bi_ge/us_cruise_ship_fire"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.c6f4c83ebb8f4cc99c782e1106c72261-ca9a2b46a81a4b0397c1724490dcd204-0.jpg?x=130&y=84&q=85&sig=j_si9C40B0E50oDsm_2XJw--" align="left" height="84" width="130" alt="A Navy Seahawk helicopter from the USS Ronald Reagan aircraft carrier carries supplies towards the Carnival Splendor cruise ship during relief operations Tuesday, Nov. 9, 2010, in waters off Mexico's Baja Penninsula. (AP Photo/Gregory Bull)" border="0"/></a>AP - The food on the disabled cruise ship Carnival Splendor is cold and the lines to get it stretch for hours.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Deficit targets: Social Security, mortgage breaks (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_bi_ge/us_cutting_deficits"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.4b60145d3b31453a95fac7a8ade1c3a6-4b60145d3b31453a95fac7a8ade1c3a6-0.jpg?x=130&y=83&q=85&sig=4nAggu06pBJUwNnA_nrw4g--" align="left" height="83" width="130" alt="Erskine Bowles, left, accompanied by former Wyoming Sen. Alan Simpson, co-chairmen of President Barack Obama's bipartisan deficit commission, gestures while speaking on Capitol Hill in Washington Wednesday, Nov. 10, 2010.(AP Photo/Alex Brandon)" border="0"/></a>AP - In a politically incendiary plan, the bipartisan leaders of President Barack Obama's deficit commission proposed curbs in Social Security benefits, deep reductions in federal spending and higher taxes for millions of Americans Wednesday to stem a flood of red ink that they said threatens the nation's very future.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Democrats pressing Pelosi to step aside (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_go_co/us_democratic_turmoil"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.c6e2f19885794ce4a01643bc215fb757-c6e2f19885794ce4a01643bc215fb757-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=_6VeuWaKTEFMu1uP3EDr6Q--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="House Speaker Nancy Pelosi of Calif., walks through Statuary Hall, on Capitol Hill in Washington Wednesday, Nov. 10, 2010, past the set up for the news conference for House Speaker-in-waiting John Boehner of Ohio. (AP Photo/Alex Brandon)" border="0"/></a>AP - In a fresh sign of turmoil among defeated Democrats, a growing number of the rank and file say they won't support House Speaker Nancy Pelosi in a politically symbolic roll call when the new Congress meets in January.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Govt's handling of science on oil spill questioned (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_bi_ge/us_gulf_oil_spill"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101109/capt.5b49003e5af2437687b861c63db7a0ca-5b49003e5af2437687b861c63db7a0ca-0.jpg?x=130&y=75&q=85&sig=YtRKo.jQc0JuHeEbnQTxzg--" align="left" height="75" width="130" alt="Oil spill workers continue the process of cleaning tar balls and oil from the beaches of Orange Beach, Ala., Tuesday, Nov. 9, 2010. A BP official said deep cleaning operations would continue along the coast for some time. (AP Photo/Dave Martin)" border="0"/></a>AP - The oil spill that damaged the Gulf of Mexico's reefs and wetlands is also threatening to stain the Obama administration's reputation for relying on science to guide policy.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Miranda Lambert's 'Revolution' just that at CMAs (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_en_mu/us_music_cma_awards"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101111/capt.fbe59dc462bb4239aeac46608609a1e2-fbe59dc462bb4239aeac46608609a1e2-0.jpg?x=130&y=98&q=85&sig=jwarORhEpIuVkSlqRLtSQQ--" align="left" height="98" width="130" alt="Blake Shelton performs at the 43rd Annual Country Music Awards in Nashville, Tenn. Wednesday, Nov. 10, 2010. (AP Photo/Mark Humphrey)" border="0"/></a>AP - Blake Shelton won the Country Music Association's male vocalist of the year Wednesday night, ensuring a sea change in a genre that's been dominated by very familiar faces.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Steele may face challengers for GOP chairmanship (AP)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20101111/ap_on_el_ge/us_republicans_chairman"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/ap/20101110/capt.448e83c2240d4b0a8f5fe0f207a31099-448e83c2240d4b0a8f5fe0f207a31099-0.jpg?x=130&y=88&q=85&sig=4ER8hligUwGx.IN3I9BtZg--" align="left" height="88" width="130" alt="FILE - In this Nov. 2, 2010 file photo, Republican National Committee Chairman Michael Steele speaks during an election night gathering hosted by the National Republican Congressional Committee, in Washington. GOP activists are making an aggressive push to recruit a challenger to Steele, whose tenure as the central party's chief has been pocked with controversy and has been a period that some leaders are eager to put behind them. (AP Photo/Cliff Owen)" border="0"/></a>AP - Republicans are aggressively recruiting a challenger to Republican National Committee Chairman Michael Steele, whose tenure as party chief has been marked by ill-chosen comments and questions about finances.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Hong Kong unveils first minimum wage: $3.6 an hour
properties.description: Hong Kong lawmakers agreed late Thursday on terms of the city's first-ever minimum wage law, setting the hourly minimum at $28 Hong Kong dollars . The setting of the statutory minimum comes after months of consultation with labor and business groups over how much workers should be paid.

properties.title: Japan, China leaders reaffirm economic ties
properties.description: Japanese Prime Minister Naoto Kan and Chinese President Hu Jintao agreed Saturday that they would deepen cooperation on economic and global issues, a Japanese government official briefing on the meeting said.

properties.title: S. Korea's Lee says G-20 deal on imbalances likely
properties.description: Leaders at the Group of 20 major economies summit are likely to ink out indicative guidelines on addressing trade imbalances, according to reports Thursday citing South Korean President Lee Myung-bak.

properties.title: Australian sheep at lowest level since 1905
properties.description: The number of sheep in Australia has fallen to its lowest level in more than 100 years, according to preliminary data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics. The number of sheep and lamb fell to 67.7 million in the fiscal year to end-June, a 7% drop from fiscal 2009 and the lowest total since 1905, the ABS said.

properties.title: McDonald's global same-store sales up 6.5%
properties.description: McDonald's Corp. said Monday its global comparable store sales increased by 6.5% in October. Its U.S. comparable store sales rose 5.6%. Europe sales rose by 5.8%. Asia/Pacific, Middle East and Africa same-store sales increased by 5.3%.

properties.title: Japan bourse close to expanding hours, report says
properties.description: The Tokyo Stock Exchange is close to shortening its existing 90-minute lunch break to one hour to lengthen active trading periods, according to a report Thursday. The bourse will make an official decision on shortening its lunch break before the end of this month, the Nikkei business daily reported without citing sources.

properties.title: Japan to seek EU trade deal soon: report
properties.description: Japan plans to negotiate an economic partnership agreement with the European Union next spring, according to a report Thursday. The Nikkei business daily reported that Japanese Prime Minister Naoto Kan will propose a timetable for the negotiations to European Council President Herman Van Rompuy and European Commission President Jose Manuel Barroso during talks Friday on the sidelines of the Group of 20 summit in Seoul.

properties.title: Japan's Nikkei Average taps fresh four-month high
properties.description: Japanese shares climbed Thursday morning in Tokyo as a weaker yen provided a boost to exporters, lifting the Nikkei Stock Average to its highest intraday level since late June. The benchmark index tapped a high of 9,879.40, but later eased back a bit to 9,857.04, up 0.3%, even after the Cabinet Office reported a bigger-than-expected fall in September core machinery orders.

properties.title: Moody's upgrades China sovereign credit rating
properties.description: Ratings agency Moody's Investors Service upgraded its view Thursday on Chinese government bonds to Aa3 from A1 and said it would maintain its positive outlook on the nation's debt. It cited what it described as the "resilient performance" of the Chinese economy since the onset of the financial crisis, as well as exceptional growth in the nation's external payment position as reasons for the upgrade.

properties.title: Japan Sept. machinery orders undershoot forecasts
properties.description: Japanese core machinery orders fell 10.3% in September, according to seasonally adjusted data released by the Japanese Cabinet Office on Thursday. That compares with a 10.1% increase in August and fell below economists' expectations for a 9.7% month-on-month drop, according to a survey reported by Dow Jones Newswires.

properties.title: German Sept. industrial output falls 0.8%
properties.description: Industrial production in Germany unexpectedly declined 0.8% in September, the German economics ministry reported Monday. Economists surveyed by Dow Jones Newswires had forecast a 0.5% rise.

properties.title: G-20 leaders summit, China data on tap for Asia
properties.description: A meeting of the Group of 20 nations in South Korea, a ministerial summit of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation in Japan and trade data from China are among the key events on next weeks docket for Asia.

properties.title: Currencies: Dollar gains vs. most rivals except British pound
properties.description: The dollar trades mostly higher, but the British pound gains ground after the Bank of England indicates no additional quantitative easing is likely soon.

properties.title: Latin American Markets: Mexico stocks rise with IPO in sight
properties.description: Mexican stocks rise, nearly recouping losses from the previous session and ahead of expected pricing of an initial public offering.

properties.title: Canadian Markets: Bullish jobs data boost Canada stocks
properties.description: The Canadian stock market and the loonie advance after positive jobs data from both the U.S. and Canada send Toronto's benchmark index to its highest level in over a year.

properties.title: Asia Markets: G-20 leaders summit, China data on tap for Asia
properties.description: A meeting of the Group of 20 nations in South Korea, a ministerial summit of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation in Japan and trade data from China are among the key events on next week's docket for Asia.

properties.title: Asia Markets: Asia looks to rate decisions, Japan GDP
properties.description: With the Group of 20 major economies&#39; summit over, Asian markets&#39; focus in the coming week will turn to central-bank policy decisions and Japan&#39;s economic growth data.

properties.title: Europe Markets: Europe narrows losses, but banks drag
properties.description: European stock markets narrow earlier losses but remain in the red , a day after some markets hit two-year highs, with shares of banks, including Natixis, moving lower after disappointing results.

properties.title: Latin American Markets: Brazil stocks down from more than two-year high
properties.description: Brazilian stocks fall, pulling back from their best level since May 2008, with Gerdau shares under pressure after the steel maker posts a decline in quarterly profit.

properties.title: Israeli stocks fall; Cellcom gains after results
properties.description: Stocks fall in Tel Aviv, led by weakness in Perrigo, Israel Chemicals and the banks.

properties.title: Strauss-Kahn: IMF ready to help Ireland if asked
properties.description: International Monetary Fund Managing Director Dominique Strauss-Kahn says the IMF remains &#39;ready&#39; to help Ireland if it requests support, although he hasn&#39;t received any specific request from the country.

properties.title: Europe Markets: European bourses struggle for direction
properties.description: European stocks start the first session of the week roughly flat in the absence of much earnings news and as investors sell off defensive stocks in the telecoms and pharmaceutical sectors.

properties.title: 0: BoE: Inflation to fall, but outlook uncertain
properties.description: The Bank of England's quarterly inflation report shows uncertainty about the inflation outlook persists, while policy makers see improved growth prospects.

properties.title: Emerging Markets Report: Emerging markets attract steady fund inflow
properties.description: Investors continue to focus on emerging markets as the Federal Reserve unveils additional quantitative-easing measures.

properties.title: Stocks Down Under? Try Miners, Exporters
properties.description: With the Australian economy steaming ahead and the Aussie dollar trekking higher, how should investors place their bets on equities down under? Gerard Minack, head of global developed market strategy at Morgan Stanley, believes the game plan is fairly straight forward.

properties.title: Jaguar Land Rover seeks China plant
properties.description: Jaguar Land Rover, the UK-based luxury vehicle business owned by India's Tata Motors TTM, plans to produce more than 50,000 vehicles a year from a new plant in China employing up to 5,000 staff.

properties.title: Bring back sloth
properties.description: In Berlin 20 years ago, I rented a room from an Indonesian woman who had come to Germany to work and had discovered big German men. She had never gone home again. There was always a big German man or two hanging around her kitchen, and because life was slower in those days, we'd often sit around and chat.

properties.title: China eyes Portguese debt on state visit
properties.description: Hi Jintao, the president of China, has arrived in Portugal for a two-day state visit with Chinese investment in Portuguese government debt at the top of an agenda.

properties.title: Sterling at six-week high after inflation report
properties.description: The pound advanced on Wednesday to a six-week high against the euro after the Bank of England delivered a more bullish assessment of the UK economy in its quarterly inflation report.

properties.title: Talk on rules exemption buoys Tokyo financials

properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101104/bs_nm/us_gm_ipo"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101103/i/r2690060756.jpg?x=130&y=81&q=85&sig=MjbRt6dA9eLru5aBxZedLA--" align="left" height="81" width="130" alt="General Motors Chairman and CEO Ed Whitacre talks about the first assembled lithium-ion battery for the Chevrolet Volt electric vehicle during a news conference in Brownstown Township, Michigan January 7, 2010. REUTERS/Rebecca Cook" border="0"/></a>Reuters - General Motors on Wednesday finalized terms for a stock offering of about $13 billion to repay a controversial taxpayer-funded bailout and reduce the Treasury to a minority shareholder.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Greek police detonate bomb sent to French embassy (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101104/ts_nm/us_greece_bomb"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101103/i/r3847479368.jpg?x=130&y=74&q=85&sig=UVT7uBpJ5sjiuBElFEfsCA--" align="left" height="74" width="130" alt="Greek policemen patrol outside the parliament in Athens November 3, 2010. REUTERS/Yiorgos Karahalis" border="0"/></a>Reuters - Greek police detonated a parcel bomb on Thursday addressed to the French embassy in Athens and were investigating others packages at a courier company in a city suburb.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Two airlines ground A380s after emergency landing (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101104/ts_nm/us_singapore_plane"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101104/i/r2206567874.jpg?x=130&y=81&q=85&sig=kvX7VLrQXbR4a02XsTRDSQ--" align="left" height="81" width="130" alt="Technicians look at the damaged engine of Qantas Airways A380 passenger plane QF32 after it was forced to make an emergency landing at Changi airport in Singapore November 4, 2010. REUTERS/David Loh" border="0"/></a>Reuters - Qantas Airways and Singapore Airlines suspended flights of Airbus A380 superjumbos on Thursday after engine failure forced an emergency landing in Singapore.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Republicans to attack healthcare law funding (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101104/pl_nm/us_usa_elections_mcconnell"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101104/i/r2058959153.jpg?x=130&y=88&q=85&sig=aXrNrEi0ics15Rg_UC6gZQ--" align="left" height="88" width="130" alt="Senate Minority leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) speaks during an interview with Reuters in Washington, August 2, 2010. REUTERS/Jim Young" border="0"/></a>Reuters - U.S. congressional Republicans will try to repeal President Barack Obama's healthcare law next year but their leader in the Senate on Thursday acknowledged they will likely have to settle for far more modest changes.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Obama to meet congressional leaders on November 18 (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101104/pl_nm/us_usa_elections_obama_congressmeet"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101104/i/r1963343322.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=FlD.sS0SxBfQFCOwAaCOAQ--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="President Barack Obama answers a question during a post-election news conference in the East Room of the White House in Washington, November 3, 2010. REUTERS/Larry Downing" border="0"/></a>Reuters - President Barack Obama said on Thursday he invited Democratic and Republican congressional leaders to the White House on November 18 to discuss issues that could be tackled in what remains of this year's congressional term.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Obama open to discussing broad tax cut extension (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - President Barack Obama is open to the idea of discussing an extension of Bush-era tax cuts for all income levels, the White House said on Thursday.

properties.title: Fed takes bold, risky step to bolster weak economy (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - The Federal Reserve launched a fresh effort to support a struggling U.S. economy on Wednesday, committing to buy $600 billion in government bonds despite concerns the program could do more harm than good.

properties.title: Buffett derivative bet pushes Berkshire to loss (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway got the wrong end of a bet on future stock market prices in the third quarter, hurting profits and masking the substantial strength in his recently acquired railroad.

properties.title: France, China urge balanced trade, reform (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - France and China have reached a "real convergence" over the need to reform the global financial system after two days of talks between President Nicolas Sarkozy and his Chinese counterpart Hu Jintao.

properties.title: Norway sends mixed signals on U.S. spy row (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - Norway's government demanded an explanation from the United States on Friday of reports that its embassy in Oslo conducted illegal surveillance of Norwegian residents for more than 10 years.

properties.title: Peru court grants parole to U.S. citizen Berenson (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - A Peruvian court granted parole on Friday to U.S. citizen Lori Berenson after she served some 15 years of a 20-year sentence for collaborating with leftist insurgents.

properties.title: Engine problems hit second Qantas aircraft (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101105/ts_nm/us_qantas_singapore"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101105/i/r3659382888.jpg?x=130&y=103&q=85&sig=tWv.ttIamLodo5mvmrvIDA--" align="left" height="103" width="130" alt="Passengers make their way out of the terminal at Singapore's Changi airport after they disembarked from Qantas flight QF6 in Singapore November 5, 2010. REUTERS/Vivek Prakash" border="0"/></a>Reuters - Engine trouble forced a Qantas Airways Ltd jet to make an emergency landing in Singapore on Friday, less than 48 hours after another of the Australian carrier's aircraft had to land prematurely because its engine blew up.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Jump in hiring lifts spirits on economy (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - Employment surged much more than expected last month as private companies hired workers at the fastest pace since April, a sign the sluggish economy is finally starting to tick up.

properties.title: September pending home sales fall 1.8 percent (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101105/bs_nm/us_usa_economy_housing"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101105/i/r111932394.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=_T8Hf_fcj0MD98iB4CNzgA--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="People walk past tents with the sign of French association Secours Catholique (Catholic Relief) installed by members of associations who defend the right for proper housing conditions and fight against poverty on the Pont des Arts bridge on the Seine river in Paris November 5, 2010 to draw attention to the need for long-term accommodation solutions for the city's homeless. REUTERS/Gonzalo Fuentes (FRANCE - Tags: SOCIETY)" border="0"/></a>Reuters - Pending sales of previously owned U.S. homes fell unexpectedly in September, a report showed on Friday, and activity may remain volatile for months as troubles with foreclosures disrupt the market.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Al Qaeda Yemen wing claims parcel plot, UPS crash (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101105/ts_nm/us_usa_yemen_bomb"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101105/i/r2768539094.jpg?x=130&y=94&q=85&sig=G4T6QSWoPcDY88rUnusHyw--" align="left" height="94" width="130" alt="A forensic officer removes a package from a UPS container at East Midlands Airport in Castle Donington, central England October 29, 2010. REUTERS/Darren Staples" border="0"/></a>Reuters - Al Qaeda's Yemen-based wing claimed responsibility for a foiled plot to send explosive parcels to the United States last week, and for the crash of a UPS jet in Dubai in September.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: U.S. and China step back from tussle on economic policy (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101106/bs_nm/us_apec"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101106/capt.photo_1289052235760-1-0.jpg?x=130&y=84&q=85&sig=XGuVjkuAoqulK1coswTMhQ--" align="left" height="84" width="130" alt="US President Barack Obama waves after speaking at the US-India Business Council and Entrepeneurship Summit at the Trident Hotel in Mumbai. Obama Saturday unveiled 10 billion dollars in trade deals with India, seeking a US jobs dividend from a fast-rising economy he hailed as one of humanity's most stunning achievements.(AFP/Tim Sloan)" border="0"/></a>Reuters - The United States and China on Saturday appeared to take a step back from mounting criticism of each other's economic policies, but Beijing made clear it was still wary of Washington's latest move to print more money.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Germany minister now warns of terror attack threat (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101106/ts_nm/us_europe_security_germany"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101106/i/r2022998361.jpg?x=130&y=84&q=85&sig=rI1YJEioRVvyVJkrhXCuow--" align="left" height="84" width="130" alt="German Interior Minister Thomas de Maiziere speaks during a news conference after presenting the "/ border="0"/></a>Reuters - German Interior Minister Thomas de Maiziere was quoted on Saturday as saying there were "serious indications" of terror attacks in preparation in Europe and the United States but did not provide any further specific details.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Greeks vote in high-stake local elections (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - Local polls in Greece Sunday could trigger national elections in one of Europe's most economically troubled countries if they fail to give Prime Minister George Papandreou support for austerity measures.

properties.title: Obama wins India business (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101106/pl_nm/us_india_obama"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101106/i/r3042719610.jpg?x=130&y=93&q=85&sig=SODCuHqGsCm3BUVKSAg.xw--" align="left" height="93" width="130" alt="A worker carries two brooms as a poster of U.S. President Barack Obama is seen in the distance, in Mumbai November 6, 2010. Obama is arriving for a four-day visit to India. REUTERS/Jim Young" border="0"/></a>Reuters - President Barack Obama announced $10 billion in business deals on Saturday as he arrived in India to boost U.S. exports and jobs after a mauling in mid-term polls, but he ran into immediate controversy over Pakistan.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Obama rejects view of India as "land of call centers" (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101106/bs_nm/us_india_obama_exports"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101106/i/r1977219430.jpg?x=130&y=68&q=85&sig=FeR.JbW6ETM..c6lpbFXmA--" align="left" height="68" width="130" alt="U.S. President Barack Obama (C) sits next to Ajay Piramal (L) and Anand Mahindra during a meeting with entrepreneurs in Mumbai, India, November 6, 2010. REUTERS/Jason Reed" border="0"/></a>Reuters - President Barack Obama hailed India on Saturday as a vital source of U.S. growth and jobs as his administration announced relaxation of U.S. export controls to spur trade between the two countries.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Gunmen block roads after Mexican drug lord killed (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101106/ts_nm/us_mexico_drugs"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101106/i/r607593118.jpg?x=130&y=81&q=85&sig=AaahLOnkUonWJwrkXmyGkg--" align="left" height="81" width="130" alt="Burning cars block the road between Patzcuaro and Morelia November 5, 2010. REUTERS/Stringer" border="0"/></a>Reuters - Rival gunmen blocked roads near the U.S. border and strung up threatening banners on Saturday after marines killed one of Mexico's top kingpins, and Washington reaffirmed its support for the country's drug war.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Spotlight on Suu Kyi as Myanmar enters new territory (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101106/ts_nm/us_myanmar_election_suukyi"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101106/i/r2640521741.jpg?x=130&y=83&q=85&sig=AyLuXrRppqqZXZMKKc8x.w--" align="left" height="83" width="130" alt="Aung San Suu Kyi (C) meets United States Assistant Secretary of State Kurt Campbell (R) and United States embassy charge d'affaires Larry Dinger in Yangon in this May 10, 2010 file photo. REUTERS/US Embassy Rangoon/Handout/File" border="0"/></a>Reuters - Confined to her crumbling lakeside home, long-detained Nobel peace laureate Aung San Suu Kyi poses little threat to Myanmar's first election in 20 years on Sunday, but her possible release in a week could shake things up.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Summers sees prospects for eventual budget deal (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - A bipartisan agreement to tackle huge budget deficits is achievable, though it would take a lot of work, outgoing White House economic adviser Larry Summers said on Friday.

properties.title: Qantas A380 fleet could fly again within days: CEO (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101106/ts_nm/us_qantas_singapore"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101105/i/r3659382888.jpg?x=130&y=103&q=85&sig=tWv.ttIamLodo5mvmrvIDA--" align="left" height="103" width="130" alt="Passengers make their way out of the terminal at Singapore's Changi airport after they disembarked from Qantas flight QF6 in Singapore November 5, 2010. properties.title: Obama signals he may compromise on tax cuts (Reuters)

REUTERS/Larry Downing" border="0"/></a>Reuters - President Barack Obama gave his clearest signal yet on Saturday of a possible post-election compromise with resurgent Republicans that could prevent tax rates from rising for any American, even the wealthiest, come January.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Bernanke says Fed not trying to spark inflation (Reuters)

properties.title: Afghan polls protesters warn of possible violence (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - Disgruntled lawmakers and candidates in Afghanistan's parliamentary election, marred by allegations of fraud, renewed protests on Sunday over the poll and warned of possible violence if a fresh vote was not carried out.

properties.title: Obama pushes India to talk to Pakistan (Reuters)

REUTERS/Jason Reed" border="0"/></a>Reuters - President Barack Obama called on India on Sunday to bolster peace efforts with Pakistan that have floundered since the 2008 Mumbai attacks, relations seen as crucial to his troubled efforts to win the war in Afghanistan.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Erupting Indonesian volcano threatens Obama visit (Reuters)

properties.title: Myanmar votes in first election in 20 years (Reuters)

REUTERS/stringer" border="0"/></a>Reuters - Myanmar voted in its first election in 20 years on Sunday under tight security, a scripted vote that assures army-backed parties an easy win but brings a hint of parliamentary politics to one of Asia's most oppressed states.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: U.S. won't know pace of Afghan drawdown for months (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101107/ts_nm/us_usa_afghanistan"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101107/i/r1626888902.jpg?x=130&y=76&q=85&sig=XYv5hU1RqZXdsN.QeNWi6A--" align="left" height="76" width="130" alt="U.S. Marines carry an Afghan national to a medevac helicopter in Helmand province, in southern Afghanistan November 6, 2010. REUTERS/Peter Andrews" border="0"/></a>Reuters - The pace of a planned U.S. drawdown from Afghanistan due to start next July may not be entirely decided until shortly before it begins, Defense Secretary Robert Gates suggested Sunday.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: U.S. military moves in Asia not aimed at China: Gates (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - U.S. military efforts to strengthen its presence in Asia are not aimed at countering China, Defense Secretary Robert Gates said Sunday, ahead of talks on deepening defense ties with regional ally Australia.

properties.title: First openly gay Episcopal bishop to retire in 2013 (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - Gene Robinson, whose consecration as the U.S. Episcopal Church's first openly gay bishop opened a deep rift in the worldwide Anglican Communion, said Saturday he planned to retire in 2013.

properties.title: Defense chief Gates backs push to end "don't ask, don't tell" (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101107/pl_nm/us_usa_military_gays"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/afp/20101104/capt.photo_1288904547620-1-0.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=6t38xR63ChsZcXHP0GDlPA--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="US Defense Secreatary Robert Gates, seen here on October 14, departs Friday for Australia and Malaysia to bolster defense ties amid concern in the region over China's growing economic and naval power.(AFP/File/Georges Gobet)" border="0"/></a>Reuters - Defense Secretary Robert Gates said on Sunday he hoped the outgoing Congress would approve legislation ending the military's ban on gays but was unsure of the prospects for success.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: DHL boss promises action over air security: report (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - Express delivery company DHL on Monday promised better screening of customers and packages before they reach airports in response to recent parcel bombs sent from Yemen and Greece.

properties.title: Industry groups lobby G20 on rare earth supply (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - G20 leaders must address bottlenecks in the global supply of rare earth elements or risk blockages in economic growth and the fight against climate change, industry groups from around the world said on Monday.

Security Council, a largely symbolic move that may put diplomatic pressure on rival regional power China.</p><br clear="all"/>

properties.title: Myanmar army-backed parties set to sweep rare poll (Reuters)
properties.description: <p><a rel="nofollow" target="_blank" href="http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/topstories/*http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20101108/ts_nm/us_myanmar_election"><img src="http://d.yimg.com/a/p/rids/20101107/i/r3174254081.jpg?x=130&y=86&q=85&sig=0udZj8.nxNxUP6CnLS_sxg--" align="left" height="86" width="130" alt="A woman casts her ballot at the polling station in Sittwe, Rakhine state November 7, 2010. properties.description: Reuters - Was the creation of the Financial Stability Board last year a bloodless coup by the world's central bankers? A repeal of the U.S. Declaration of Independence? That's certainly how some in America view the new body which is supposed to plug the holes in the world's financial regulations.

properties.description: Reuters - Leaders of a presidential commission proposed raising taxes and the retirement age among bold ideas on Wednesday for slashing the U.S. budget deficit, but faced a difficult task in winning the support of Congress.

properties.title: Obama warns North Korea it risks deeper isolation (Reuters)

properties.title: Boeing halts 787 flights as emergency landing probed (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - Boeing Co halted test flights of its 787 Dreamliner on Wednesday, a day after an electrical fire aboard one of its test planes forced an emergency landing in Texas, but said it was too early to tell if the incident would push back the plane's delivery schedule.

properties.title: Iraq breaks deadlock, PM wins support for new term (Reuters)

properties.title: U.S. close to decision on 9/11 trial for Khalid Sheikh Mohammed (Reuters)
properties.description: Reuters - The Obama administration is close to deciding where the self-professed mastermind of the September 11 attacks in 2001 will be tried and whether he will face a military tribunal, Attorney General Eric Holder said on Wednesday.

properties.title:

    (AP)

    (AP)

    (AP)
properties.description: AP - A phone-hacking scandal cost the News of the World more advertisers and a prestigious link with military veterans Thursday after another paper reported that the tabloid had collected the telephone numbers of relatives of slain troops.

properties.title:
NATO denies trying to aid Libyan rebels' advance 
    (AP)
properties.description: AP - NATO is denying a Libyan government claim that the alliance is intentionally using its airstrikes to assist rebel advances.

Hundreds of police deploy at Israel's airport 
    (AP)
properties.description: AP - Hundreds of police, including undercover officers, took up positions at Israel's international airport on Thursday in anticipation of the arrival of pro-Palestinian activists, a police spokesman said.

properties.title:
Fewer people sought unemployment aid last week 
    (AP)
properties.description: AP - The number of people applying for unemployment benefits fell last week to the lowest level in seven weeks, although applications remain elevated.

    (AP)

    (Reuters)
